Q_A_ANGLE_BOOST.Description: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

Q_A_INPUT_TC.Description: Attitude control input time constant. Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response

Q_A_RAT_PIT_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain
Q_A_RAT_PIT_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FILT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FILT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTD.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTD.Description: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTE.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTE.Description: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain
Q_A_RAT_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

Q_A_RAT_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum
Q_A_RAT_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Q_A_RAT_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain
Q_A_RAT_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

Q_A_RAT_RLL_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
Q_A_RAT_RLL_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FILT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FILT.Description: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTD.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTD.Description: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTE.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTE.Description: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTT.Description: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain
Q_A_RAT_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

Q_A_RAT_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum
Q_A_RAT_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Q_A_RAT_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain
Q_A_RAT_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

Q_A_RAT_YAW_D.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain
Q_A_RAT_YAW_D.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FF.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FF.Description: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FILT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FILT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTD.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTD.Description: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTE.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTE.Description: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

Q_A_RAT_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain
Q_A_RAT_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

Q_A_RAT_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum
Q_A_RAT_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

Q_A_RAT_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain
Q_A_RAT_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output

Q_A_RATE_FF_ENAB.Description: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

Q_A_RATE_P_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in pitch axis

Q_A_RATE_R_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in roll axis

Q_A_RATE_Y_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in yaw axis

Q_A_SLEW_YAW.Description: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

Q_A_THR_MIX_MAN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Q_A_THR_MIX_MAX.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Q_A_THR_MIX_MIN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

Q_ACCEL_Z.Description: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

Q_ACRO_PIT_RATE.Description: The maximum pitch rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

Q_ACRO_RLL_RATE.Description: The maximum roll rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

Q_ACRO_YAW_RATE.Description: The maximum yaw rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

Q_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Maximum lean angle in all VTOL flight modes

Q_ASSIST_ALT.Description: This is the altitude below which quadplane assistance will be triggered. This acts the same way as Q_ASSIST_ANGLE and Q_ASSIST_SPEED, but triggers if the aircraft drops below the given altitude while the VTOL motors are not running. A value of zero disables this feature. The altutude is calculated as being above ground level. The height above ground is given from a Lidar used if available and RNGFND_LANDING=1. Otherwise it comes from terrain data if TERRAIN_FOLLOW=1 and comes from height above home otherwise.

Q_ASSIST_ANGLE.Description: This is the angular error in attitude beyond which the quadplane VTOL motors will provide stability assistance. This will only be used if Q_ASSIST_SPEED is also non-zero. Assistance will be given if the attitude is outside the normal attitude limits by at least 5 degrees and the angular error in roll or pitch is greater than this angle for at least 1 second. Set to zero to disable angle assistance.

Q_ASSIST_SPEED.Description: This is the speed below which the quad motors will provide stability and lift assistance in fixed wing modes. Zero means no assistance except during transition

Q_AUTOTUNE_AGGR.Description: Autotune aggressiveness. Defines the bounce back used to detect size of the D term.

Q_AUTOTUNE_AXES.Values: 7:All,1:Roll Only,2:Pitch Only,4:Yaw Only,3:Roll and Pitch,5:Roll and Yaw,6:Pitch and Yaw

Q_ENABLE.Description: This enables QuadPlane functionality, assuming multicopter motors start on output 5. If this is set to 2 then when starting AUTO mode it will initially be in VTOL AUTO mode.

Q_ESC_CAL.Description: This is used to calibrate the throttle range of the VTOL motors. Please read https://ardupilot.org/plane/docs/quadplane-esc-calibration.html before using. This parameter is automatically set back to 0 on every boot. This parameter only takes effect in QSTABILIZE mode. When set to 1 the output of all motors will come directly from the throttle stick when armed, and will be zero when disarmed. When set to 2 the output of all motors will be maximum when armed and zero when disarmed. Make sure you remove all properllers before using.

Q_FRAME_CLASS.Description: Controls major frame class for multicopter component

Q_FRAME_TYPE.Description: Controls motor mixing for multicopter component

Q_FW_LND_APR_RAD.DisplayName: Quadplane fixed wing landing approach radius
Q_FW_LND_APR_RAD.Description: This provides the radius used, when using a fixed wing landing approach. If set to 0 then the WP_LOITER_RAD will be selected.

Q_GUIDED_MODE.Description: This enables use of VTOL in guided mode. When enabled the aircraft will switch to VTOL flight when the guided destination is reached and hover at the destination.

Q_LAND_FINAL_ALT.Description: The altitude at which we should switch to Q_LAND_SPEED descent rate

Q_LAND_ICE_CUT.Description: This controls stopping an internal combustion engine in the final landing stage of a VTOL. This is important for aircraft where the forward thrust engine may experience prop-strike if left running during landing. This requires the engine controls are enabled using the ICE_* parameters.

Q_LAND_SPEED.Description: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

Q_LOIT_ACC_MAX.Description: Loiter maximum correction acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values cause the copter to correct position errors more aggressively.

Q_LOIT_ANG_MAX.Description: Loiter maximum lean angle. Set to zero for 2/3 of PSC_ANGLE_MAX or ANGLE_MAX

Q_LOIT_BRK_ACCEL.Description: Loiter braking acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values stop the copter more quickly when the stick is centered.

Q_LOIT_BRK_JERK.Description: Loiter braking jerk in cm/s/s/s. Higher values will remove braking faster if the pilot moves the sticks during a braking maneuver.

Q_LOIT_SPEED.Description: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

Q_M_BAT_CURR_MAX.Description: Maximum current over which maximum throttle is limited (0 = Disabled)

Q_M_BAT_CURR_TC.Description: Time constant used to limit the maximum current

Q_M_BAT_IDX.Description: Which battery monitor should be used for doing compensation

Q_M_BAT_VOLT_MAX.Description: Battery voltage compensation maximum voltage (voltage above this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 4.4 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

Q_M_BAT_VOLT_MIN.Description: Battery voltage compensation minimum voltage (voltage below this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 3.5 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

Q_M_BOOST_SCALE.Description: Booster motor output scaling factor vs main throttle. The output to the BoostThrottle servo will be the main throttle times this scaling factor. A higher scaling factor will put more of the load on the booster motor. A value of 1 will set the BoostThrottle equal to the main throttle.

Q_M_HOVER_LEARN.Description: Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover throttle

Q_M_PWM_MAX.Description: This sets the max PWM value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MAX

Q_M_PWM_MIN.Description: This sets the min PWM output value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MIN

Q_M_PWM_TYPE.Description: This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot, brushed or DShot motor output

Q_M_SAFE_DISARM.DisplayName: Motor PWM output disabled when disarmed
Q_M_SAFE_DISARM.Description: Disables motor PWM output when disarmed
Q_M_SAFE_DISARM.Values: 0:PWM enabled while disarmed, 1:PWM disabled while disarmed

Q_M_SAFE_TIME.DisplayName: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.
Q_M_SAFE_TIME.Description: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.

Q_M_SLEW_DN_TIME.DisplayName: Output slew time for decreasing throttle
Q_M_SLEW_DN_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to slew output from full to zero. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.

Q_M_SLEW_UP_TIME.DisplayName: Output slew time for increasing throttle
Q_M_SLEW_UP_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to slew output from zero to full. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.

Q_M_SPIN_ARM.Description: Point at which the motors start to spin expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be lower than MOT_SPIN_MIN.

Q_M_SPIN_MAX.Description: Point at which the thrust saturates expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range

Q_M_SPIN_MIN.Description: Point at which the thrust starts expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be higher than MOT_SPIN_ARM.

Q_M_SPOOL_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to spool up the motors from zero to min throttle.

Q_M_THST_EXPO.Description: Motor thrust curve exponent (from 0 for linear to 1.0 for second order curve)

Q_M_THST_HOVER.Description: Motor thrust needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1

Q_M_YAW_HEADROOM.Description: Yaw control is given at least this pwm in microseconds range

Q_MAV_TYPE.Description: This controls the mavlink type given in HEARTBEAT messages. For some GCS types a particular setting will be needed for correct operation.

Q_OPTIONS.Description: This provides a set of additional control options for quadplanes. LevelTransition means that the wings should be held level to within LEVEL_ROLL_LIMIT degrees during transition to fixed wing flight, and the vehicle will not use the vertical lift motors to climb during the transition. If AllowFWTakeoff bit is not set then fixed wing takeoff on quadplanes will instead perform a VTOL takeoff. If AllowFWLand bit is not set then fixed wing land on quadplanes will instead perform a VTOL land. If respect takeoff frame is not set the vehicle will interpret all takeoff waypoints as an altitude above the corrent position. When Use QRTL is set it will replace QLAND with QRTL for failsafe actions when in VTOL modes.
Q_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:LevelTransition,1:AllowFWTakeoff,2:AllowFWLand,3:Respect takeoff frame types,4:Use a fixed wing approach for VTOL landings,5:Use QRTL instead of QLAND for failsafe when in VTOL modes,6:Use idle governor in MANUAL

Q_P_ACC_XY_FILT.Description: Lower values will slow the response of the navigation controller and reduce twitchiness

Q_P_ACCZ_D.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

Q_P_ACCZ_FLTD.DisplayName: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz
Q_P_ACCZ_FLTD.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz

Q_P_ACCZ_FLTE.DisplayName: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz
Q_P_ACCZ_FLTE.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz

Q_P_ACCZ_FLTT.DisplayName: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz
Q_P_ACCZ_FLTT.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz

Q_P_ACCZ_I.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

Q_P_ACCZ_IMAX.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

Q_P_ACCZ_P.Description: Acceleration (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

Q_P_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Maximum lean angle autopilot can request. Set to zero to use ANGLE_MAX parameter value

Q_P_POSXY_P.Description: Position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

Q_P_POSZ_P.Description: Position (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

Q_P_VELXY_D.Description: Velocity (horizontal) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

Q_P_VELXY_D_FILT.Description: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

Q_P_VELXY_FILT.Description: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

Q_P_VELXY_I.Description: Velocity (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired velocity to a target acceleration

Q_P_VELXY_IMAX.Description: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

Q_P_VELXY_P.Description: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

Q_P_VELZ_P.Description: Velocity (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

Q_RC_SPEED.Description: This is the PWM refresh rate in Hz for QuadPlane quad motors

Q_RTL_ALT.Description: The altitude which QRTL mode heads to initially

Q_RTL_MODE.Description: If this is set to 1 then an RTL will change to QRTL when within RTL_RADIUS meters of the RTL destination

Q_TAILSIT_ANGLE.Description: This is the angle at which tailsitter aircraft will change from VTOL control to fixed wing control.

Q_TAILSIT_GSCMIN.DisplayName: Minimum gain scaling based on throttle and attitude
Q_TAILSIT_GSCMIN.Description: Minimum gain scaling at high throttle/tilt angle

Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK.Description: Bitmask of gain scaling methods to be applied: BOOST: boost gain at low throttle, ATT_THR: reduce gain at high throttle/tilt, INTERP: interpolate between fixed-wing and copter controls

Q_TAILSIT_INPUT.Description: This controls whether stick input when hovering as a tailsitter follows the conventions for fixed wing hovering or multicopter hovering. When PlaneMode is not enabled (bit0 = 0) the roll stick will roll the aircraft in earth frame and yaw stick will yaw in earth frame. When PlaneMode input is enabled, the roll and yaw sticks are swapped so that the roll stick controls earth-frame yaw and rudder controls earth-frame roll. When body-frame roll is enabled (bit1 = 1), the yaw stick controls earth-frame yaw rate and the roll stick controls roll in the tailsitter's body frame when flying level.

Q_TAILSIT_MASK.Description: This controls what channels have full manual control when hovering as a tailsitter and the Q_TAILSIT_MASKCH channel in high. This can be used to teach yourself to prop-hang a 3D plane by learning one or more channels at a time.

Q_TAILSIT_MASKCH.Description: This controls what input channel will activate the Q_TAILSIT_MASK mask. When this channel goes above 1700 then the pilot will have direct manual control of the output channels specified in Q_TAILSIT_MASK. Set to zero to disable.

Q_TAILSIT_MOTMX.Description: Bitmask of motors to remain active in forward flight for a 'copter' tailsitter. Non-zero indicates airframe is a tailsitter which pitches forward 90 degrees in forward flight modes.

Q_TAILSIT_RLL_MX.Description: Maximum Allowed roll angle for tailsitters. If this is zero then Q_ANGLE_MAX is used.

Q_TAILSIT_THSCMX.Description: Maximum value of throttle scaling for tailsitter velocity scaling, reduce this value to remove low throttle oscillations

Q_TAILSIT_VFGAIN.DisplayName: Tailsitter vector thrust gain in forward flight
Q_TAILSIT_VFGAIN.Description: This controls the amount of vectored thrust control used in forward flight for a vectored tailsitter

Q_TAILSIT_VHGAIN.DisplayName: Tailsitter vector thrust gain in hover
Q_TAILSIT_VHGAIN.Description: This controls the amount of vectored thrust control used in hover for a vectored tailsitter

Q_TAILSIT_VHPOW.Description: This controls the amount of extra pitch given to the vectored control when at high pitch errors

Q_THR_MAX_PWM.Description: This is the maximum PWM output for the quad motors

Q_THR_MIN_PWM.Description: This is the minimum PWM output for the quad motors

Q_THROTTLE_EXPO.Description: Amount of curvature in throttle curve: 0 is linear, 1 is cubic

Q_TILT_MASK.Description: This is a bitmask of motors that are tiltable in a tiltrotor (or tiltwing). The mask is in terms of the standard motor order for the frame type.

Q_TILT_MAX.Description: This is the maximum angle of the tiltable motors at which multicopter control will be enabled. Beyond this angle the plane will fly solely as a fixed wing aircraft and the motors will tilt to their maximum angle at the TILT_RATE

Q_TILT_RATE_DN.Description: This is the maximum speed at which the motor angle will change for a tiltrotor when moving from hover to forward flight. When this is zero the Q_TILT_RATE_UP value is used.

Q_TILT_RATE_UP.Description: This is the maximum speed at which the motor angle will change for a tiltrotor when moving from forward flight to hover

Q_TILT_TYPE.Description: This is the type of tiltrotor when TILT_MASK is non-zero. A continuous tiltrotor can tilt the rotors to any angle on demand. A binary tiltrotor assumes a retract style servo where the servo is either fully forward or fully up. In both cases the servo can't move faster than Q_TILT_RATE. A vectored yaw tiltrotor will use the tilt of the motors to control yaw in hover, Bicopter tiltrottor must use the tailsitter frame class (10)

Q_TILT_YAW_ANGLE.DisplayName: Tilt minimum angle for vectored yaw
Q_TILT_YAW_ANGLE.Description: This is the angle of the tilt servos when in VTOL mode and at minimum output. This needs to be set for Q_TILT_TYPE=3 to enable vectored control for yaw of tricopter tilt quadplanes. This is also used to limit the forwards travel of bicopter tilts when in VTOL modes

Q_TKOFF_ARSP_LIM.Description: Airspeed limit during takeoff. If the airspeed exceeds this level the vehicle will switch to QLAND. This is useful for ensuring that you don't takeoff into excessively strong wind. If set to 0 there is no limit on airspeed during takeoff.

Q_TKOFF_FAIL_SCL.Description: Scalar for how long past the expected takeoff time a takeoff should be considered as failed and the vehicle will switch to QLAND. If set to 0 there is no limit on takeoff time.

Q_TRAN_PIT_MAX.Description: Maximum pitch during transition to auto fixed wing flight

Q_TRANS_DECEL.Description: This is deceleration rate that will be used in calculating the stopping distance when transitioning from fixed wing flight to multicopter flight.

Q_TRANS_FAIL.Description: Maximum time allowed for forward transitions, exceeding this time will cancel the transition and the aircraft will immediately change to QLAND. 0 for no limit.

Q_TRANSITION_MS.Description: Transition time in milliseconds after minimum airspeed is reached

Q_TRIM_PITCH.Description: This sets the compensation for the pitch angle trim difference between forward and vertical flight pitch, NOTE! this is relative to forward flight trim not mounting locaiton. For tailsitters this is relative to a baseline of 90 degrees.

Q_VELZ_MAX.Description: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

Q_VFWD_ALT.Description: Controls altitude to disable forward velocity assist when below this relative altitude. This is useful to keep the forward velocity propeller from hitting the ground. Rangefinder height data is incorporated when available.

Q_VFWD_GAIN.Description: Controls use of forward motor in vtol modes. If this is zero then the forward motor will not be used for position control in VTOL modes. A value of 0.05 is a good place to start if you want to use the forward motor for position control. No forward motor will be used in QSTABILIZE or QHOVER modes. Use QLOITER for position hold with the forward motor.

Q_WP_ACCEL.Description: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

Q_WP_ACCEL_Z.Description: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

Q_WP_RADIUS.Description: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

Q_WP_RFND_USE.DisplayName: Waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following
Q_WP_RFND_USE.Description: This controls if waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following

Q_WP_SPEED.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

Q_WP_SPEED_DN.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

Q_WP_SPEED_UP.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

Q_WVANE_GAIN.Description: This controls the tendency to yaw to face into the wind. A value of 0.1 is to start with and will give a slow turn into the wind. Use a value of 0.4 for more rapid response. The weathervaning works by turning into the direction of roll.

Q_WVANE_MINROLL.Description: This set the minimum roll in degrees before active weathervaning will start. This may need to be larger if your aircraft has bad roll trim.

Q_YAW_RATE_MAX.Description: This is the maximum yaw rate for pilot input on rudder stick in degrees/second

RALLY_INCL_HOME.Description: Controls if Home is included as a Rally point (i.e. as a safe landing place) for RTL

RALLY_LIMIT_KM.Description: Maximum distance to rally point. If the closest rally point is more than this number of kilometers from the current position and the home location is closer than any of the rally points from the current position then do RTL to home rather than to the closest rally point. This prevents a leftover rally point from a different airfield being used accidentally. If this is set to 0 then the closest rally point is always used.

RALLY_TOTAL.Description: Number of rally points currently loaded

RC_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:Ignore RC Receiver, 1:Ignore MAVLink Overrides, 2:Ignore Receiver Failsafe, 3:FPort Pad, 4:Log RC input bytes, 5:Arming check throttle for 0 input, 6:Skip the arming check for neutral Roll/Pitch/Yay sticks

RC_OVERRIDE_TIME.Description: Timeout after which RC overrides will no longer be used, and RC input will resume, 0 will disable RC overrides, -1 will never timeout, and continue using overrides until they are disabled

RC1_DZ.Description: PWM dead zone in microseconds around trim or bottom

RC1_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_OPTION.Description: Function assigned to this RC channel

RCMAP_FORWARD.Description: Forward channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Forward is normally on channel 5, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RCMAP_LATERAL.Description: Lateral channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Lateral is normally on channel 6, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RCMAP_PITCH.Description: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RCMAP_ROLL.Description: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RCMAP_THROTTLE.Description: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Warning APM 2.X: Changing the throttle channel could produce unexpected fail-safe results if connection between receiver and on-board PPM Encoder is lost. Disabling on-board PPM Encoder is recommended. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RCMAP_YAW.Description: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

RELAY_DEFAULT.Description: The state of the relay on boot.

RELAY_PIN.Description: Digital pin number for first relay control. This is the pin used for camera control.
RELAY_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:AUXOUT1,51:AUXOUT2,52:AUXOUT3,53:AUXOUT4,54:AUXOUT5,55:AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,113:BB Blue GP0 pin 6,116:BB Blue GP0 pin 5

RELAY_PIN2.Description: Digital pin number for 2nd relay control.
RELAY_PIN2.Values: -1:Disabled,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:AUXOUT1,51:AUXOUT2,52:AUXOUT3,53:AUXOUT4,54:AUXOUT5,55:AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,113:BB Blue GP0 pin 6,116:BB Blue GP0 pin 5

RELAY_PIN3.Description: Digital pin number for 3rd relay control.
RELAY_PIN3.Values: -1:Disabled,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:AUXOUT1,51:AUXOUT2,52:AUXOUT3,53:AUXOUT4,54:AUXOUT5,55:AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,113:BB Blue GP0 pin 6,116:BB Blue GP0 pin 5

RELAY_PIN4.Description: Digital pin number for 4th relay control.
RELAY_PIN4.Values: -1:Disabled,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:AUXOUT1,51:AUXOUT2,52:AUXOUT3,53:AUXOUT4,54:AUXOUT5,55:AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,113:BB Blue GP0 pin 6,116:BB Blue GP0 pin 5

RELAY_PIN5.Description: Digital pin number for 5th relay control.
RELAY_PIN5.Values: -1:Disabled,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:AUXOUT1,51:AUXOUT2,52:AUXOUT3,53:AUXOUT4,54:AUXOUT5,55:AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,113:BB Blue GP0 pin 6,116:BB Blue GP0 pin 5

RELAY_PIN6.Description: Digital pin number for 6th relay control.
RELAY_PIN6.Values: -1:Disabled,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:AUXOUT1,51:AUXOUT2,52:AUXOUT3,53:AUXOUT4,54:AUXOUT5,55:AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,113:BB Blue GP0 pin 6,116:BB Blue GP0 pin 5

RLL2SRV_D.Description: Damping gain from roll acceleration to ailerons. Higher values reduce rolling in turbulence, but can cause oscillations. Automatically set and adjusted by AUTOTUNE mode.

RLL2SRV_FF.Description: Gain from demanded rate to aileron output.

RLL2SRV_I.Description: Integrator gain from long-term roll angle offsets to ailerons. Higher values "trim" out offsets faster but can cause oscillations. Automatically set and adjusted by AUTOTUNE mode.

RLL2SRV_IMAX.Description: Limit of roll integrator gain in centi-degrees of servo travel. Servos are assumed to have +/- 4500 centi-degrees of travel, so a value of 3000 allows trim of up to 2/3 of servo travel range.

RLL2SRV_P.Description: Proportional gain from roll angle demands to ailerons. Higher values allow more servo response but can cause oscillations. Automatically set and adjusted by AUTOTUNE mode.

RLL2SRV_RMAX.Description: Maximum roll rate that the roll controller demands (degrees/sec) in ACRO mode.

RLL2SRV_TCONST.Description: Time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved roll angle. Most models respond well to 0.5. May be reduced for faster responses, but setting lower than a model can achieve will not help.

RNGFND_LANDING.Description: This enables the use of a rangefinder for automatic landing. The rangefinder will be used both on the landing approach and for final flare

RNGFND1_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and UAVCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses. A value of 0 disables the sensor.

RNGFND1_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground
RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

RNGFND1_MAX_CM.Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND1_MIN_CM.Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND1_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFND1_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input
RNGFND1_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,11:PX4-airspeed port, 15:Pixhawk-airspeed port,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6

RNGFND1_POS_X.Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND1_PWRRNG.Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

RNGFND1_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFND1_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

RNGFND1_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.
RNGFND1_STOP_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RNGFND1_TYPE.Description: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

RNGFND9_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFND9_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

RNGFND9_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.
RNGFND9_STOP_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RNGFND9_TYPE.Description: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

RNGFNDA_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and UAVCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses. A value of 0 disables the sensor.

RNGFNDA_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFNDA_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground
RNGFNDA_GNDCLEAR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

RNGFNDA_MAX_CM.Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFNDA_MIN_CM.Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFNDA_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFNDA_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input
RNGFNDA_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,11:PX4-airspeed port, 15:Pixhawk-airspeed port,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6

RNGFNDA_POS_X.Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFNDA_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFNDA_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFNDA_PWRRNG.Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

RNGFNDA_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFNDA_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

RNGFNDA_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.
RNGFNDA_STOP_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RNGFNDA_TYPE.Description: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

RPM_MIN_QUAL.Description: Minimum data quality to be used

RPM_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

RPM_TYPE.Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

RPM2_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

RPM2_TYPE.Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

RSSI_ANA_PIN.Description: Pin used to read the RSSI voltage or PWM value

RSSI_CHAN_HIGH.Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_CHAN_LOW

RSSI_CHAN_LOW.Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_CHAN_HIGH

RSSI_CHANNEL.Description: The channel number where RSSI will be output by the radio receiver (5 and above).

RSSI_PIN_HIGH.Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_PIN_LOW

RSSI_PIN_LOW.Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_PIN_HIGH

RSSI_TYPE.Description: Radio Receiver RSSI type. If your radio receiver supports RSSI of some kind, set it here, then set its associated RSSI_XXXXX parameters, if any.

RST_MISSION_CH.Description: Enables a channel to reset the mission to the first waypoint. Mission restart is triggered by channel rising above 1750 PWM. 0 disables.

RST_SWITCH_CH.Description: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

RTL_AUTOLAND.Description: Automatically begin landing sequence after arriving at RTL location. This requires the addition of a DO_LAND_START mission item, which acts as a marker for the start of a landing sequence. The closest landing sequence will be chosen to the current location.
RTL_AUTOLAND.Values: 0:Disable,1:Enable - go HOME then land,2:Enable - go directly to landing sequence

RTL_CLIMB_MIN.Description: The vehicle will climb this many m during the initial climb portion of the RTL. During this time the roll will be limited to LEVEL_ROLL_LIMIT degrees.

RTL_RADIUS.Description: Defines the radius of the loiter circle when in RTL mode. If this is zero then WP_LOITER_RAD is used. If the radius is negative then a counter-clockwise is used. If positive then a clockwise loiter is used.

RUDD_DT_GAIN.Description: gain control from rudder to differential thrust

RUDDER_ONLY.Description: Enable rudder only mode. The rudder will control attitude in attitude controlled modes (such as FBWA). You should setup your transmitter to send roll stick inputs to the RCMAP_YAW channel (normally channel 4). The rudder servo should be attached to the RCMAP_YAW channel as well. Note that automatic ground steering will be disabled for rudder only aircraft. You should also set KFF_RDDRMIX to 1.0. You will also need to setup the YAW2SRV_DAMP yaw damping appropriately for your aircraft. A value of 0.5 for YAW2SRV_DAMP is a good starting point.

SCALING_SPEED.DisplayName: speed used for speed scaling calculations
SCALING_SPEED.Description: Airspeed in m/s to use when calculating surface speed scaling. Note that changing this value will affect all PID values

SCHED_DEBUG.Description: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

SCHED_LOOP_RATE.Description: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

SCR_DEBUG_LVL.Description: The higher the number the more verbose builtin scripting debug will be.

SCR_HEAP_SIZE.Description: Amount of memory available for scripting

SCR_VM_I_COUNT.Description: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

SERIAL_PASS1.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASS2.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASSTIMO.Description: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL0_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the console.

SERIAL1_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.
SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA

SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.
SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None, 1:MAVLink1, 2:MAVLink2, 3:Frsky D, 4:Frsky SPort, 5:GPS, 7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial, 8:SToRM32 Gimbal Serial, 9:Rangefinder, 10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX), 11:Lidar360, 13:Beacon, 14:Volz servo out, 15:SBus servo out, 16:ESC Telemetry, 17:Devo Telemetry, 18:OpticalFlow, 19:RobotisServo, 20:NMEA Output, 21:WindVane, 22:SLCAN, 23:RCIN, 24:MegaSquirt EFI, 25:LTM, 26:RunCam, 27:HottTelem, 28:Scripting

SERIAL2_BAUD.Description: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL2_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
SERIAL2_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA

SERIAL2_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem2 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.
SERIAL2_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None, 1:MAVLink1, 2:MAVLink2, 3:Frsky D, 4:Frsky SPort, 5:GPS, 7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial, 8:SToRM32 Gimbal Serial, 9:Rangefinder, 10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX), 11:Lidar360, 13:Beacon, 14:Volz servo out, 15:SBus servo out, 16:ESC Telemetry, 17:Devo Telemetry, 18:OpticalFlow, 19:RobotisServo, 20:NMEA Output, 21:WindVane, 22:SLCAN, 23:RCIN, 24:MegaSquirt EFI, 25:LTM, 26:RunCam, 27:HottTelem, 28:Scripting

SERVO_AUTO_TRIM.Description: This enables automatic servo trim in flight. Servos will be trimed in stabilized flight modes when the aircraft is close to level. Changes to servo trim will be saved every 10 seconds and will persist between flights. The automatic trim won't go more than 20% away from a centered trim.

SERVO_BLH_AUTO.Description: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors

SERVO_BLH_DEBUG.Description: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

SERVO_BLH_MASK.Description: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

SERVO_BLH_OTYPE.Description: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

SERVO_BLH_POLES.Description: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

SERVO_BLH_PORT.Description: This sets the serial port to use for blheli pass-thru

SERVO_BLH_REMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are reversible. This is used for ESCs which have been configured in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

SERVO_BLH_TEST.Description: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

SERVO_BLH_TMOUT.Description: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

SERVO_BLH_TRATE.Description: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

SERVO_RATE.Description: This sets the default output rate in Hz for all outputs.

SERVO_ROB_POSMAX.Description: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_ROB_POSMIN.Description: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_SBUS_RATE.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

SERVO_VOLZ_MASK.Description: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

SERVO1_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Seeing this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO1_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO1_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO1_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO1_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO10_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Seeing this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO10_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO10_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO10_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO10_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO11_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Seeing this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO11_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO11_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO11_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO11_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO12_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Seeing this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO12_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO12_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO12_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO15_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO16_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO16_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO16_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO2_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Seeing this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO2_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO2_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO2_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO2_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SIM_GRPE_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPE_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper emp is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPS_GRAB.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to initiate grabbing the cargo

SIM_GRPS_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper servo is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_RELEASE.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to release the cargo

SIM_PLD_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Preland simulation

SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.DisplayName: Precland device origin's height above sealevel
SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.Description: Precland device origin's height above sealevel

SIM_PLD_RATE.Description: Precland device rate. e.g led patter refresh rate, RF message rate, etc.

SIM_PLD_TYPE.Description: Precland device radiance type: it can be a cylinder, a cone, or a sphere.

SIM_PLD_YAW.DisplayName: Precland device systems rotation from north
SIM_PLD_YAW.Description: Precland device systems rotation from north

SIM_SPR_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Sprayer simulation

SIM_SPR_PUMP.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer pump is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_SPR_SPIN.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer spinner servo is connected to. (start at 1)

SOAR_ALT_CUTOFF.DisplayName: Maximum power altitude, relative to the home location
SOAR_ALT_CUTOFF.Description: Cut off throttle at this alt.

SOAR_ALT_MAX.DisplayName: Maximum soaring altitude, relative to the home location
SOAR_ALT_MAX.Description: Don't thermal any higher than this.

SOAR_ALT_MIN.DisplayName: Minimum soaring altitude, relative to the home location
SOAR_ALT_MIN.Description: Don't get any lower than this.

SOAR_DIST_AHEAD.Description: Initial guess of the distance to the thermal center

SOAR_ENABLE.DisplayName: Is the soaring mode enabled or not
SOAR_ENABLE.Description: Toggles the soaring mode on and off

SOAR_ENABLE_CH.DisplayName: (Optional) RC channel that toggles the soaring controller on and off
SOAR_ENABLE_CH.Description: Toggles the soaring controller on and off. This parameter has any effect only if SOAR_ENABLE is set to 1 and this parameter is set to a valid non-zero channel number. When set, soaring will be activated when RC input to the specified channel is greater than or equal to 1700.

SOAR_MAX_DRIFT.DisplayName: (Optional) Maximum drift distance to allow when thermalling.
SOAR_MAX_DRIFT.Description: The previous mode will be restored if the horizontal distance to the thermalling start location exceeds this value. 0 to disable.

SOAR_MAX_RADIUS.Description: RTL will be entered when a thermal is exited and the plane is more than this distance from home. -1 to disable.

SOAR_MIN_CRSE_S.Description: Minimum number of seconds to spend cruising

SOAR_MIN_THML_S.Description: Minimum number of seconds to spend thermalling

SOAR_Q1.Description: Standard deviation of noise in process for strength

SOAR_Q2.Description: Standard deviation of noise in process for position and radius

SOAR_R.Description: Standard deviation of noise in measurement

SOAR_VSPEED.Description: Rate of climb to trigger themalling speed
