RNGFNDA_STOP_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RNGFNDA_TYPE.Description: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

RPM_MIN_QUAL.Description: Minimum data quality to be used

RPM_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

RPM_TYPE.Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

RPM2_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

RPM2_TYPE.Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

RSSI_ANA_PIN.Description: Pin used to read the RSSI voltage or PWM value

RSSI_CHAN_HIGH.Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_CHAN_LOW

RSSI_CHAN_LOW.Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_CHAN_HIGH

RSSI_CHANNEL.Description: The channel number where RSSI will be output by the radio receiver (5 and above).

RSSI_PIN_HIGH.Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_PIN_LOW

RSSI_PIN_LOW.Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_PIN_HIGH

RSSI_TYPE.Description: Radio Receiver RSSI type. If your radio receiver supports RSSI of some kind, set it here, then set its associated RSSI_XXXXX parameters, if any.

RST_SWITCH_CH.Description: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

RTL_SPEED.Description: Return-to-Launch speed default. If zero use WP_SPEED or CRUISE_SPEED.

SAIL_ANGLE_IDEAL.Description: Ideal angle between sail and apparent wind

SAIL_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Mainsheet loose, angle between centerline and boom

SAIL_ANGLE_MIN.Description: Mainsheet tight, angle between centerline and boom

SAIL_HEEL_MAX.Description: When in auto sail trim modes the heel will be limited to this value using PID control

SAIL_LOIT_RADIUS.Description: When in sailing modes the vehicle will keep moving within this loiter radius

SAIL_NO_GO_ANGLE.Description: The typical closest angle to the wind the vehicle will sail at. the vehicle will sail at this angle when going upwind

SAIL_WNDSPD_MIN.DisplayName: Sailboat minimum wind speed to sail in
SAIL_WNDSPD_MIN.Description: Sailboat minimum wind speed to continue sail in, at lower wind speeds the sailboat will motor if one is fitted

SAIL_XTRACK_MAX.DisplayName: Sailing vehicle max cross track error
SAIL_XTRACK_MAX.Description: The sail boat will tack when it reaches this cross track error, defines a corridor of 2 times this value wide, 0 disables

SCHED_DEBUG.Description: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

SCHED_LOOP_RATE.Description: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

SCR_DEBUG_LVL.Description: The higher the number the more verbose builtin scripting debug will be.

SCR_HEAP_SIZE.Description: Amount of memory available for scripting

SCR_VM_I_COUNT.Description: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

SERIAL_PASS1.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASS2.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASSTIMO.Description: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL0_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the console.

SERIAL1_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.
SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA

SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.
SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None, 1:MAVLink1, 2:MAVLink2, 3:Frsky D, 4:Frsky SPort, 5:GPS, 7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial, 8:SToRM32 Gimbal Serial, 9:Rangefinder, 10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX), 11:Lidar360, 13:Beacon, 14:Volz servo out, 15:SBus servo out, 16:ESC Telemetry, 17:Devo Telemetry, 18:OpticalFlow, 19:RobotisServo, 20:NMEA Output, 21:WindVane, 22:SLCAN, 23:RCIN, 24:MegaSquirt EFI, 25:LTM, 26:RunCam, 27:HottTelem, 28:Scripting

SERIAL2_BAUD.Description: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL2_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

SERVO_AUTO_TRIM.Description: This enables automatic servo trim in flight. Servos will be trimed in stabilized flight modes when the aircraft is close to level. Changes to servo trim will be saved every 10 seconds and will persist between flights. The automatic trim won't go more than 20% away from a centered trim.

SERVO_BLH_AUTO.Description: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors

SERVO_BLH_DEBUG.Description: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

SERVO_BLH_MASK.Description: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

SERVO_BLH_OTYPE.Description: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

SERVO_BLH_POLES.Description: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

SERVO_BLH_PORT.Description: This sets the serial port to use for blheli pass-thru

SERVO_BLH_REMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are reversible. This is used for ESCs which have been configured in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

SERVO_BLH_TEST.Description: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

SERVO_BLH_TMOUT.Description: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

SERVO_BLH_TRATE.Description: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

SERVO_RATE.Description: This sets the default output rate in Hz for all outputs.

SERVO_ROB_POSMAX.Description: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_ROB_POSMIN.Description: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_SBUS_RATE.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

SERVO_VOLZ_MASK.Description: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

SERVO1_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Seeing this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO1_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO1_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO1_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO1_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO10_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Seeing this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO8_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO9_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Seeing this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO9_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO9_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO9_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO9_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SIM_GRPE_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPE_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper emp is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPS_GRAB.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to initiate grabbing the cargo

SIM_GRPS_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper servo is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_RELEASE.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to release the cargo

SIM_PLD_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Preland simulation

SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.DisplayName: Precland device origin's height above sealevel
SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.Description: Precland device origin's height above sealevel

SIM_PLD_RATE.Description: Precland device rate. e.g led patter refresh rate, RF message rate, etc.

SIM_PLD_TYPE.Description: Precland device radiance type: it can be a cylinder, a cone, or a sphere.

SIM_PLD_YAW.DisplayName: Precland device systems rotation from north
SIM_PLD_YAW.Description: Precland device systems rotation from north

SIM_SPR_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Sprayer simulation

SIM_SPR_PUMP.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer pump is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_SPR_SPIN.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer spinner servo is connected to. (start at 1)

SPEED_MAX.Description: Maximum speed vehicle can obtain at full throttle. If 0, it will be estimated based on CRUISE_SPEED and CRUISE_THROTTLE.

SPRAY_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the sprayer

SPRAY_PUMP_MIN.Description: Minimum pump speed expressed as a percentage

SPRAY_PUMP_RATE.Description: Desired pump speed when traveling 1m/s expressed as a percentage

SPRAY_SPEED_MIN.Description: Speed minimum at which we will begin spraying

SPRAY_SPINNER.Description: Spinner's rotation speed in PWM (a higher rate will disperse the spray over a wider area horizontally)

SPRAYER_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the sprayer

SPRAYER_PUMP_MIN.Description: Minimum pump speed expressed as a percentage

SPRAYER_PUMP_RATE.Description: Desired pump speed when traveling 1m/s expressed as a percentage

SPRAYER_SPEED_MIN.Description: Speed minimum at which we will begin spraying

SPRAYER_SPINNER.Description: Spinner's rotation speed in PWM (a higher rate will disperse the spray over a wider area horizontally)

SRTL_ACCURACY.Description: SmartRTL accuracy. The minimum distance between points.

SRTL_POINTS.DisplayName: SmartRTL maximum number of points on path
SRTL_POINTS.Description: SmartRTL maximum number of points on path. Set to 0 to disable SmartRTL. 100 points consumes about 3k of memory.

STAT_BOOTCNT.Description: Number of times board has been booted

STAT_RESET.Description: Seconds since January 1st 2016 (Unix epoch+1451606400) since statistics reset (set to 0 to reset statistics)

STICK_MIXING.Description: When enabled, this adds steering user stick input in auto modes, allowing the user to have some degree of control without changing modes.

SYSID_ENFORCE.Description: This controls whether packets from other than the expected GCS system ID will be accepted

SYSID_MYGCS.Description: The identifier of the ground station in the MAVLink protocol. Don't change this unless you also modify the ground station to match.

SYSID_THIS_MAV.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
SYSID_THIS_MAV.Description: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

SYSID_THISMAV.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
SYSID_THISMAV.Description: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

TELEM_DELAY.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

TURN_MAX_G.Description: The maximum turning acceleration (in units of gravities) that the rover can handle while remaining stable. The navigation code will keep the lateral acceleration below this level to avoid rolling over or slipping the wheels in turns

TURN_RADIUS.Description: Turn radius of vehicle in meters while at low speeds. Lower values produce tighter turns in steering mode

VISO_POS_X.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera X position offset
VISO_POS_X.Description: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

VISO_POS_Y.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Y position offset
VISO_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

VISO_POS_Z.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Z position offset
VISO_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

WENC_CPR.Description: WheelEncoder counts per full revolution of the wheel

WENC_POS_X.Description: X position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

WENC_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

WENC_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

WENC_TYPE.Description: What type of WheelEncoder is connected

WENC2_CPR.Description: WheelEncoder 2 counts per full revolution of the wheel

WENC2_POS_X.Description: X position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

WENC2_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

WENC2_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

WENC2_TYPE.Description: What type of WheelEncoder sensor is connected

WNDVN_CAL.Description: Start wind vane calibration by setting this to 1 or 2

WNDVN_DIR_DZ.DisplayName: Wind vane deadzone when using analog sensor
WNDVN_DIR_DZ.Description: Wind vane deadzone when using analog sensor

WNDVN_DIR_FILT.DisplayName: Wind vane direction low pass filter frequency
WNDVN_DIR_FILT.Description: Wind vane direction low pass filter frequency, a value of -1 disables filter

WNDVN_DIR_OFS.Description: Angle offset when analog windvane is indicating a headwind, ie 0 degress relative to vehicle

WNDVN_DIR_PIN.DisplayName: Wind vane analog voltage pin for direction
WNDVN_DIR_PIN.Description: Analog input pin to read as wind vane direction

WNDVN_DIR_V_MAX.Description: Maximum voltage supplied by analog wind vane

WNDVN_DIR_V_MIN.Description: Minimum voltage supplied by analog wind vane

WNDVN_RC_IN_NO.DisplayName: Wind vane sensor RC Input Channel
WNDVN_RC_IN_NO.Description: RC Input Channel to use as wind angle value

WNDVN_SPEED_FILT.DisplayName: Wind speed low pass filter frequency
WNDVN_SPEED_FILT.Description: Wind speed low pass filter frequency, a value of -1 disables filter

WNDVN_SPEED_MIN.DisplayName: Wind vane cut off wind speed
WNDVN_SPEED_MIN.Description: Wind vane direction will be ignored when apparent wind speeds are below this value (if wind speed sensor is present). If the apparent wind is consistently below this value the vane will not work

WNDVN_SPEED_OFS.DisplayName: Wind speed sensor analog voltage offset
WNDVN_SPEED_OFS.Description: Wind sensor analog voltage offset at zero wind speed

WNDVN_SPEED_PIN.DisplayName: Wind vane speed sensor analog pin
WNDVN_SPEED_PIN.Description: Wind speed analog speed input pin for Modern Devices Wind Sensor rev. p

WNDVN_TEMP_PIN.DisplayName: Wind vane speed sensor analog temp pin
WNDVN_TEMP_PIN.Description: Wind speed sensor analog temp input pin for Modern Devices Wind Sensor rev. p, set to -1 to diasble temp readings

WNDVN_TYPE.Values: 0:None,1:Heading when armed,2:RC input offset heading when armed,3:Analog,4:NMEA,10:SITL

WP_OVERSHOOT.Description: Waypoint overshoot maximum in meters. The vehicle will attempt to stay within this many meters of the track as it completes one waypoint and moves to the next.

WP_PIVOT_ANGLE.Description: Pivot when the difference bewteen the vehicle's heading and it's target heading is more than this many degrees. Set to zero to disable pivot turns

WP_RADIUS.Description: The distance in meters from a waypoint when we consider the waypoint has been reached. This determines when the vehicle will turn toward the next waypoint.

WP_SPEED_MIN.Description: Vehicle will not slow below this speed for corners. Should be set to boat's plane speed. Does not apply to pivot turns.

WRC_ENABLE.Description: Enable or disable wheel rate control

WRC_RATE_D.Description: Wheel rate control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired rate vs actual

WRC_RATE_FF.DisplayName: Wheel rate control feed forward gain
WRC_RATE_FF.Description: Wheel rate control feed forward gain. Desired rate (in radians/sec) is multiplied by this constant and output to output (in the range -1 to +1)

WRC_RATE_FILT.Description: Wheel rate control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

WRC_RATE_FLTD.DisplayName: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz
WRC_RATE_FLTD.Description: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz

WRC_RATE_FLTE.DisplayName: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz
WRC_RATE_FLTE.Description: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz

WRC_RATE_FLTT.DisplayName: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz
WRC_RATE_FLTT.Description: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz

WRC_RATE_I.Description: Wheel rate control I gain. Corrects long term error between the desired rate (in rad/s) and actual

WRC_RATE_IMAX.DisplayName: Wheel rate control I gain maximum
WRC_RATE_IMAX.Description: Wheel rate control I gain maximum. Constrains the output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

WRC_RATE_P.Description: Wheel rate control P gain. Converts rate error (in radians/sec) to output (in the range -1 to +1)

WRC2_RATE_D.Description: Wheel rate control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired rate vs actual

WRC2_RATE_FF.DisplayName: Wheel rate control feed forward gain
WRC2_RATE_FF.Description: Wheel rate control feed forward gain. Desired rate (in radians/sec) is multiplied by this constant and output to output (in the range -1 to +1)

WRC2_RATE_FILT.Description: Wheel rate control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

WRC2_RATE_FLTD.DisplayName: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz
WRC2_RATE_FLTD.Description: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz

WRC2_RATE_FLTE.DisplayName: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz
WRC2_RATE_FLTE.Description: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz

WRC2_RATE_FLTT.DisplayName: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz
WRC2_RATE_FLTT.Description: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz

WRC2_RATE_I.Description: Wheel rate control I gain. Corrects long term error between the desired rate (in rad/s) and actual

WRC2_RATE_IMAX.DisplayName: Wheel rate control I gain maximum
WRC2_RATE_IMAX.Description: Wheel rate control I gain maximum. Constrains the output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

WRC2_RATE_P.Description: Wheel rate control P gain. Converts rate error (in radians/sec) to output (in the range -1 to +1)

ACRO_BAL_PITCH.Description: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

ACRO_BAL_ROLL.Description: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

ACRO_EXPO.Description: Acro roll/pitch Expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

ACRO_RP_P.DisplayName: Acro Roll and Pitch P gain
ACRO_RP_P.Description: Converts pilot roll and pitch into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO and SPORT mode. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

ACRO_TRAINER.Description: Type of trainer used in acro mode

ACRO_YAW_P.Description: Converts pilot yaw input into a desired rate of rotation. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

AHRS_COMP_BETA.DisplayName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
AHRS_COMP_BETA.Description: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT.Description: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL.Description: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW.Description: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_EKF_TYPE.DisplayName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
AHRS_EKF_TYPE.Description: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.Description: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_MINSATS.Description: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

AHRS_GPS_USE.Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS whenever it is available.

AHRS_ORIENTATION.Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

AHRS_RP_P.Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_TRIM_X.Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

AHRS_TRIM_Y.Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

AHRS_WIND_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

AHRS_YAW_P.Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

ANGLE_MAX.Description: Maximum lean angle in all flight modes

ARMING_ACCTHRESH.Description: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

ARMING_CHECK.Description: Checks prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks that will be performed before allowing arming. The default is no checks, allowing arming at any time. You can select whatever checks you prefer by adding together the values of each check type to set this parameter. For example, to only allow arming when you have GPS lock and no RC failsafe you would set ARMING_CHECK to 72. For most users it is recommended that you set this to 1 to enable all checks.
ARMING_CHECK.Values: 0:None,1:All,2:Barometer,4:Compass,8:GPS Lock,16:INS(INertial Sensors - accels & gyros),32:Parameters(unused),64:RC Channels,128:Board voltage,256:Battery Level,1024:LoggingAvailable,2048:Hardware safety switch,4096:GPS configuration,8192:System,16384:Mission,32768:RangeFinder,65536:Camera,131072:AuxAuth,524288:FFT
ARMING_CHECK.Bitmask: 0:All,1:Barometer,2:Compass,3:GPS lock,4:INS,5:Parameters,6:RC Channels,7:Board voltage,8:Battery Level,10:Logging Available,11:Hardware safety switch,12:GPS Configuration,13:System,14:Mission,15:Rangefinder,16:Camera,17:AuxAuth,18:VisualOdometry,19:FFT

ARMING_MIS_ITEMS.Description: Bitmask of mission items that are required to be planned in order to arm the aircraft

ARMING_REQUIRE.Description: Arming disabled until some requirements are met. If 0, there are no requirements (arm immediately). If 1, require rudder stick or GCS arming before arming motors and sends the minimum throttle PWM value to the throttle channel when disarmed. If 2, require rudder stick or GCS arming and send 0 PWM to throttle channel when disarmed. See the ARMING_CHECK_* parameters to see what checks are done before arming. Note, if setting this parameter to 0 a reboot is required to arm the plane. Also note, even with this parameter at 0, if ARMING_CHECK parameter is not also zero the plane may fail to arm throttle at boot due to a pre-arm check failure.
ARMING_REQUIRE.Values: 0:Disabled,1:THR_MIN PWM when disarmed,2:0 PWM when disarmed

ARMING_RUDDER.Description: Allow arm/disarm by rudder input. When enabled arming can be done with right rudder, disarming with left rudder. Rudder arming only works in manual throttle modes with throttle at zero +- deadzone (RCx_DZ)

ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.DisplayName: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant
ATC_ANG_LIM_TC.Description: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

ATC_ANG_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis angle controller P gain
ATC_ANG_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate

ATC_ANG_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis angle controller P gain
ATC_ANG_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

ATC_ANG_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis angle controller P gain
ATC_ANG_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

ATC_ANGLE_BOOST.Description: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

ATC_INPUT_TC.Description: Attitude control input time constant. Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response

ATC_RAT_PIT_D.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain
ATC_RAT_PIT_D.Description: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_PIT_FF.Description: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_PIT_FILT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FILT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD.Description: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTE.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTE.Description: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTT.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTT.Description: Pitch axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_PIT_I.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain
ATC_RAT_PIT_I.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum
ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

ATC_RAT_PIT_P.DisplayName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain
ATC_RAT_PIT_P.Description: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

ATC_RAT_RLL_D.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
ATC_RAT_RLL_D.Description: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_RLL_FF.Description: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_RLL_FILT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FILT.Description: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD.Description: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE.Description: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT.Description: Roll axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_RLL_I.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain
ATC_RAT_RLL_I.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum
ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX.Description: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

ATC_RAT_RLL_P.DisplayName: Roll axis rate controller P gain
ATC_RAT_RLL_P.Description: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

ATC_RAT_YAW_D.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain
ATC_RAT_YAW_D.Description: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward
ATC_RAT_YAW_FF.Description: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

ATC_RAT_YAW_FILT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FILT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTD.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTD.Description: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTE.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTE.Description: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTT.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz
ATC_RAT_YAW_FLTT.Description: Yaw axis rate controller input frequency in Hz

ATC_RAT_YAW_I.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain
ATC_RAT_YAW_I.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum
ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

ATC_RAT_YAW_P.DisplayName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain
ATC_RAT_YAW_P.Description: Yaw axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output

ATC_RATE_FF_ENAB.Description: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

ATC_RATE_P_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in pitch axis

ATC_RATE_R_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in roll axis

ATC_RATE_Y_MAX.Description: Maximum angular velocity in yaw axis

ATC_SLEW_YAW.Description: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

ATC_THR_MIX_MAN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

ATC_THR_MIX_MAX.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

ATC_THR_MIX_MIN.Description: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

AVOID_ANGLE_MAX.DisplayName: Avoidance max lean angle in non-GPS flight modes
AVOID_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Max lean angle used to avoid obstacles while in non-GPS modes

AVOID_DIST_MAX.DisplayName: Avoidance distance maximum in non-GPS flight modes
AVOID_DIST_MAX.Description: Distance from object at which obstacle avoidance will begin in non-GPS modes

AVOID_MARGIN.DisplayName: Avoidance distance margin in GPS modes
AVOID_MARGIN.Description: Vehicle will attempt to stay at least this distance (in meters) from objects while in GPS modes

BATT_AMP_OFFSET.Description: 电池1电流传感器零电流时的数值偏移

BATT_AMP_PERVLT.Description: 电池1电流传感器上1V读数所对应的安培数。 对于使用3DR Power版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。对于使用3DR 4in1 ESC版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。

BATT_ARM_MAH.DisplayName: 解锁所需电池1剩余电量
BATT_ARM_MAH.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池1的剩余电量。设置为0可在任何剩余容量下解锁飞机。 请注意，除了智能电池重新启动之外，飞机始终会重置剩余电量估算值，这可能会导致此检查无法提供足够的保护，建议始终将此功能与以下功能结合使用：@

BATT_ARM_VOLT.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池1的电压。设置为0允许在任何电压下解锁。

BATT_BUS.DisplayName: 电池1监控器的I2C总线编号
BATT_BUS.Description: 电池1监控器的I2C总线编号。

BATT_CAPACITY.Description: 电池1的总容量（以mAh为单位）

BATT_CRT_MAH.Description: 触发低电量保护的电池1的电池容量。设置为0可禁用低电量保护功能。 如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT_CRT_VOLT.Description: 触发电池1的低电压故障保护的电压值。设置为0则禁用。 如果电池电压持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT_CURR_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电池1电流监控的模拟输入引脚。

BATT_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: 遇到电池1故障，飞机应采取的措施。

BATT_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: 电池1电量不足时，飞机应采取什么措施。

BATT_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: 用于检测电池1电压的算法
BATT_FS_VOLTSRC.Values: 0:原始电压数据, 1:凹陷补偿电压

BATT_LOW_MAH.Description: 触发电池1低电量的电池容量。 设置为0可禁用电池低电量保护功能。如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT_LOW_TIMER.Description: 这是触发电池1低电压事件之前的延时时间（以秒为单位）。对于具有低C电池的飞机，可能有必要将延时调长，以应对加速或起飞时的瞬时压降。 ‘0’值将不启用此功能。

BATT_LOW_VOLT.Description: 触发电池低电量保护动作的电池电压。 设置为0则禁用。如果电池电压连续持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT_MONITOR.Description: 通过控件可以监视电池的电压和电流
BATT_MONITOR.Values: 0:不允许,3:仅ADC电压,4:ADC电压和电流,5:单口,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Maxell,8:UAVCAN-电池信息,9:BLHeli ESC回传（DShot）,10:SumOfFollowing,11:FuelFlow,12:燃油水平PWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign

BATT_SERIAL_NUM.Description: 自动为SMBus电池填写的电池序列号，否则为-1。 对于UAVCAN，它是battery_id。

BATT_VOLT_MULT.Description: 用于转换感应引脚的电压(@

BATT_VOLT_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电压监视的模拟输入引脚。

BATT_WATT_MAX.Description: 如果电池输出瓦数（电压*电流）超过此值，则系统将减小油门（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）以满足此限制。 这有助于在使用低倍率电池的飞机上安全的飞行，而不管电池电压如何。 当实际电流小于了最大电流值 且 实际功率低于了最大功率值，则各油门限制将缓慢增长回原始设置值（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）。 ‘0’禁用。

BATT2_AMP_OFFSET.Description: 电池2电流传感器零电流时的数值偏移

BATT2_AMP_PERVLT.Description: 电池2电流传感器上1V读数所对应的安培数。 对于使用3DR Power版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。对于使用3DR 4in1 ESC版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。

BATT2_ARM_MAH.DisplayName: 解锁所需电池2剩余电量
BATT2_ARM_MAH.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池2的剩余电量。设置为0可在任何剩余容量下解锁飞机。 请注意，除了智能电池重新启动之外，飞机始终会重置剩余电量估算值，这可能会导致此检查无法提供足够的保护，建议始终将此功能与以下功能结合使用：@

BATT2_ARM_VOLT.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池2的电压。设置为0允许在任何电压下解锁。

BATT2_BUS.DisplayName: 电池2监控器的I2C总线编号
BATT2_BUS.Description: 电池2监控器的I2C总线编号。

BATT2_CAPACITY.Description: 电池2的总容量（以mAh为单位）

BATT2_CRT_MAH.Description: 触发低电量保护的电池2的电池容量。设置为0可禁用低电量保护功能。 如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: 遇到电池2故障，飞机应采取的措施。

BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC.Values: 0:原始电压数据, 1:凹陷补偿电压

BATT2_MONITOR.Values: 0:不允许,3:仅ADC电压,4:ADC电压和电流,5:单口,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Maxell,8:UAVCAN-电池信息,9:BLHeli ESC回传（DShot）,10:SumOfFollowing,11:FuelFlow,12:燃油水平PWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign

BATT2_VOLT_MULT.Description: 用于转换感应引脚的电压(@

BATT5_LOW_TIMER.Description: 这是触发电池5低电压事件之前的延时时间（以秒为单位）。对于具有低C电池的飞机，可能有必要将延时调长，以应对加速或起飞时的瞬时压降。 ‘0’值将不启用此功能。

BATT5_LOW_VOLT.Description: 触发电池5的低电压故障保护的电压值。设置为0则禁用。 如果电池电压持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT5_MONITOR.Description: 通过控件可以监视电池的电压和电流
BATT5_MONITOR.Values: 0:不允许,3:仅ADC电压,4:ADC电压和电流,5:单口,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Maxell,8:UAVCAN-电池信息,9:BLHeli ESC回传（DShot）,10:SumOfFollowing,11:FuelFlow,12:燃油水平PWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign

BATT5_SERIAL_NUM.Description: 自动为SMBus电池填写的电池序列号，否则为-1。 对于UAVCAN，它是battery_id。

BATT5_VOLT_MULT.Description: 用于转换感应引脚的电压(@

BATT5_VOLT_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电压监视的模拟输入引脚。

BATT5_WATT_MAX.Description: 如果电池输出瓦数（电压*电流）超过此值，则系统将减小油门（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）以满足此限制。 这有助于在使用低倍率电池的飞机上安全的飞行，而不管电池电压如何。 当实际电流小于了最大电流值 且 实际功率低于了最大功率值，则各油门限制将缓慢增长回原始设置值（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）。 ‘0’禁用。

BATT6_AMP_OFFSET.Description: 电池6电流传感器零电流时的数值偏移

BATT6_AMP_PERVLT.Description: 电池6电流传感器上1V读数所对应的安培数。 对于使用3DR Power版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。对于使用3DR 4in1 ESC版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。

BATT6_ARM_MAH.DisplayName: 解锁所需电池6剩余电量
BATT6_ARM_MAH.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池6的剩余电量。设置为0可在任何剩余容量下解锁飞机。 请注意，除了智能电池重新启动之外，飞机始终会重置剩余电量估算值，这可能会导致此检查无法提供足够的保护，建议始终将此功能与以下功能结合使用：@

BATT6_ARM_VOLT.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池6的电压。设置为0允许在任何电压下解锁。

BRD_ALT_CONFIG.Description: Select an alternative hardware configuration. A value of zero selects the default configuration for this board. Other values are board specific. Please see the documentation for your board for details on any alternative configuration values that may be available.

BRD_BOOT_DELAY.Description: This adds a delay in milliseconds to boot to ensure peripherals initialise fully

BRD_IMU_TARGTEMP.Description: This sets the target IMU temperature for boards with controllable IMU heating units. DO NOT SET -1 on The Cube. A value of -1 sets PH1 behaviour

BRD_IO_ENABLE.Description: This allows for the IO co-processor on FMUv1 and FMUv2 to be disabled

BRD_PWM_COUNT.Description: Controls number of FMU outputs which are setup for PWM. All unassigned pins can be used for GPIO
BRD_PWM_COUNT.Values: 0:No PWMs,1:One PWMs,2:Two PWMs,3:Three PWMs,4:Four PWMs,5:Five PWMs,6:Six PWMs,7:Seven PWMs,8:Eight PWMs

BRD_PWM_VOLT_SEL.Description: This sets the voltage max for PWM output pulses. 0 for 3.3V and 1 for 5V output.

BRD_RADIO_ABLVL.Description: This sets the minimum RSSI of an auto-bind packet for it to be accepted. This should be set so that auto-bind will only happen at short range to minimise the change of an auto-bind happening accidentially

BRD_RADIO_ABTIME.Description: When non-zero this sets the time with no transmitter packets before we start looking for auto-bind packets.

BRD_RADIO_BZOFS.Description: Set transmitter buzzer note adjustment (adjust frequency up)

BRD_RADIO_FCCTST.DisplayName: Put radio into FCC test mode
BRD_RADIO_FCCTST.Description: If this is enabled then the radio will continuously transmit as required for FCC testing. The transmit channel is set by the value of the parameter. The radio will not work for RC input while this is enabled

BRD_RADIO_PPSCH.Description: Channel to show received packet-per-second rate, or zero for disabled

BRD_RADIO_SIGCH.Description: Channel to show receive RSSI signal strength, or zero for disabled

BRD_RADIO_STKMD.Description: This selects between different stick input modes. The default is mode2, which has throttle on the left stick and pitch on the right stick. You can instead set mode1, which has throttle on the right stick and pitch on the left stick.

BRD_RADIO_TELEM.Description: If this is non-zero then telemetry packets will be sent over DSM

BRD_RADIO_TESTCH.DisplayName: Set radio to factory test channel
BRD_RADIO_TESTCH.Description: This sets the radio to a fixed test channel for factory testing. Using a fixed channel avoids the need for binding in factory testing.

BRD_RADIO_TPPSCH.Description: Channel to show telemetry packets-per-second value, as received at TX

BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH.DisplayName: RSSI value channel for telemetry data on transmitter
BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH.Description: Channel to show telemetry RSSI value as received by TX

BRD_RADIO_TXMAX.Description: Set transmitter maximum transmit power (from 1 to 8)

BRD_RADIO_TXPOW.Description: Set telemetry transmit power. This is the power level (from 1 to 8) for telemetry packets sent from the RX to the TX

BRD_RADIO_TYPE.DisplayName: Set type of direct attached radio
BRD_RADIO_TYPE.Description: This enables support for direct attached radio receivers

BRD_RTC_TYPES.Description: Specifies which sources of UTC time will be accepted

BRD_RTC_TZ_MIN.Description: Adds offset in +- minutes from UTC to calculate local time

BRD_SAFETY_MASK.DisplayName: Outputs which ignore the safety switch state
BRD_SAFETY_MASK.Description: A bitmask which controls what outputs can move while the safety switch has not been pressed

BRD_SAFETYENABLE.DisplayName: Enable use of safety arming switch
BRD_SAFETYENABLE.Description: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.

BRD_SAFETYOPTION.Description: This controls the activation of the safety button. It allows you to control if the safety button can be used for safety enable and/or disable, and whether the button is only active when disarmed
BRD_SAFETYOPTION.Bitmask: 0:ActiveForSafetyEnable,1:ActiveForSafetyDisable,2:ActiveWhenArmed,3:Force safety on when the aircraft disarms

BRD_SBUS_OUT.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

BRD_SD_SLOWDOWN.Description: This is a scaling factor to slow down microSD operation. It can be used on flight board and microSD card combinations where full speed is not reliable. For normal full speed operation a value of 0 should be used.

BRD_SER1_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1) on Pixhawk. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

BRD_SER2_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2) on Pixhawk and STATE. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SERIAL_NUM.Description: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

BRD_TYPE.Description: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)
BRD_TYPE.Values: 0:AUTO,1:PX4V1,2:Pixhawk,3:Cube/Pixhawk2,4:Pixracer,5:PixhawkMini,6:Pixhawk2Slim,7:VRBrain 5.1,8:VRBrain 5.2,9:VR Micro Brain 5.1,10:VR Micro Brain 5.2,11:VRBrain Core 1.0,12:VRBrain 5.4,13:Intel Aero FC,20:AUAV2.1

BRD_VBUS_MIN.Description: Minimum voltage on the autopilot power rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

BRD_VSERVO_MIN.Description: Minimum voltage on the servo rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

BTN0_FUNCTION.Description: Set to 0 to disable or choose a function

BTN9_SFUNCTION.DisplayName: Function for button when the shift mode is toggled on
BTN9_SFUNCTION.Description: Set to 0 to disable or choose a function

CAM_AUTO_ONLY.Description: When enabled, trigging by distance is done in AUTO mode only.

CAM_DURATION.DisplayName: Duration that shutter is held open
CAM_DURATION.Description: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

CAM_FEEDBACK_PIN.Description: pin number to use for save accurate camera feedback messages. If set to -1 then don't use a pin flag for this, otherwise this is a pin number which if held high after a picture trigger order, will save camera messages when camera really takes a picture. A universal camera hot shoe is needed. The pin should be held high for at least 2 milliseconds for reliable trigger detection. See also the CAM_FEEDBACK_POL option.

CAM_FEEDBACK_POL.Description: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the feedback pin should go high on trigger. If set to 0 then it should go low

CAM_MAX_ROLL.Description: Postpone shooting if roll is greater than limit. (0=Disable, will shoot regardless of roll).

CAM_MIN_INTERVAL.Description: Postpone shooting if previous picture was taken less than preset time(ms) ago.

CAM_RELAY_ON.Description: This sets whether the relay goes high or low when it triggers. Note that you should also set RELAY_DEFAULT appropriately for your camera

CAM_SERVO_OFF.Description: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

CAM_SERVO_ON.Description: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is activated

CAM_TRIGG_DIST.Description: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

CAM_TRIGG_TYPE.Description: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

CAM_TYPE.Description: Set the camera type that is being used, certain cameras have custom functions that need further configuration, this enables that.

CAN_D1_KDE_NPOLE.Description: 设置电动机极数以计算正确的转速(RPM)值

CAN_D1_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: 通过虚拟驱动程序启用特定协议的使用
CAN_D1_PROTOCOL.Description: 启用此选项将启动将使用此虚拟驱动程序的选定协议

CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将通过UAVCAN作为ESC传输
CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM.Description: 具有一组通道的位掩码，可通过UAVCAN作为ESC命令发送通道

CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将作为伺服通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM.Description: 具有一组用于通道的位掩码，以作为通道命令通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM.Bitmask: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

CAN_D1_UC_SRV_RT.Description: 伺服输出的最大传输速率，单位Hz

CAN_D2_KDE_NPOLE.Description: 设置电动机极数以计算正确的转速(RPM)值

CAN_D2_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: 通过虚拟驱动程序启用特定协议的使用
CAN_D2_PROTOCOL.Description: 启用此选项将启动将使用此虚拟驱动程序的选定协议

CAN_D2_UC_ESC_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将通过UAVCAN作为ESC传输
CAN_D2_UC_ESC_BM.Description: 具有一组通道的位掩码，可通过UAVCAN作为ESC命令发送通道

CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将作为伺服通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM.Description: 具有一组用于通道的位掩码，以作为通道命令通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM.Bitmask: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

CAN_D2_UC_SRV_RT.Description: 伺服输出的最大传输速率，单位Hz

CAN_D3_KDE_NPOLE.Description: 设置电动机极数以计算正确的转速(RPM)值

CAN_D3_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: 通过虚拟驱动程序启用特定协议的使用
CAN_D3_PROTOCOL.Description: 启用此选项将启动将使用此虚拟驱动程序的选定协议

CAN_D3_UC_ESC_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将通过UAVCAN作为ESC传输
CAN_D3_UC_ESC_BM.Description: 具有一组通道的位掩码，可通过UAVCAN作为ESC命令发送通道

CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将作为伺服通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM.Description: 具有一组用于通道的位掩码，以作为通道命令通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM.Bitmask: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

CAN_D3_UC_SRV_RT.Description: 伺服输出的最大传输速率，单位Hz

CAN_P1_DEBUG.Description: 启用此选项将提供调试消息

CAN_P1_DRIVER.Description: 启用此选项将启用CAN总线。

CAN_P2_DEBUG.Description: 启用此选项将提供调试消息

CAN_P2_DRIVER.Description: 启用此选项将启用CAN总线。

CAN_P3_DEBUG.Description: 启用此选项将提供调试消息

CAN_P3_DRIVER.Description: 启用此选项将启用CAN总线。

CAN_SLCAN_CPORT.Description: CAN Driver ID to be routed to SLCAN, 0 means no routing

CAN_SLCAN_SERNUM.Description: Serial Port ID to be used for temporary SLCAN iface, -1 means no temporary serial. This parameter is automatically reset on reboot or on timeout. See CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT for timeout details

CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT.Description: Duration of inactivity after which SLCAN is switched back to original protocol in seconds.

CIRCLE_CONTROL.Description: Enable or disable using the pitch/roll stick control circle mode's radius and rate

CIRCLE_RADIUS.Description: Defines the radius of the circle the vehicle will fly when in Circle flight mode

CIRCLE_RATE.Description: Circle mode's turn rate in deg/sec. Positive to turn clockwise, negative for counter clockwise

COMPASS_AUTO_ROT.Description: When enabled this will automatically check the orientation of compasses on successful completion of compass calibration. If set to 2 then external compasses will have their orientation automatically corrected.

COMPASS_AUTODEC.Description: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

COMPASS_CAL_FIT.Description: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

COMPASS_CUS_PIT.Description: Compass mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_CUS_ROLL.Description: Compass mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_CUS_YAW.Description: Compass mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_DEC.Description: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

COMPASS_DEV_ID.Description: Compass device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID2.Description: Second compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID3.Description: Third compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID4.Description: Extra 4th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID5.Description: Extra 5th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID6.Description: Extra 6th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID7.Description: Extra 7th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID8.Description: Extra 8th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DIA_X.DisplayName: 指南针软铁对角线X分量
COMPASS_DIA_X.Description: 指南针软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_X：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Y.Description: 指南针软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Y：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Z.DisplayName: 指南针软铁对角线Z分量
COMPASS_DIA_Z.Description: 指南针软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Z：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_X.Description: 指南针2软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_X：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Y.Description: 指南针2软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Y：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Z.DisplayName: 指南针2软铁对角线Z分量
COMPASS_DIA2_Z.Description: 指南针2软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Z：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_X.Description: 指南针3软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_X：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Y.Description: 指南针3软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Y：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Z.DisplayName: 指南针3软铁对角线Z分量
COMPASS_DIA3_Z.Description: 指南针3软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Z：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

COMPASS_EXP_DID.Description: The expected value of COMPASS_DEV_ID, used by arming checks. Setting this to -1 means "don't care."

COMPASS_EXP_DID2.Description: The expected value of COMPASS_DEV_ID2, used by arming checks. Setting this to -1 means "don't care."

COMPASS_EXP_DID3.Description: The expected value of COMPASS_DEV_ID3, used by arming checks. Setting this to -1 means "don't care."

COMPASS_EXTERN2.DisplayName: Compass2 is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERN2.Description: Configure second compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_EXTERN3.DisplayName: Compass3 is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERN3.Description: Configure third compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_EXTERNAL.DisplayName: Compass is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERNAL.Description: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_FLTR_RNG.DisplayName: Range in which sample is accepted
COMPASS_FLTR_RNG.Description: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

COMPASS_LEARN.Description: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle. If InFlight learning is enabled then the compass with automatically start learning once a flight starts (must be armed). While InFlight learning is running you cannot use position control modes.

COMPASS_MOT_X.DisplayName: 机身框架X轴的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT_X.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT_Y.DisplayName: 机身框架Y轴的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT_Y.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的Y轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT_Z.DisplayName: 机身框架Z轴的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT_Z.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的Z轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT2_X.DisplayName: 机身框架X轴对罗盘2的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT2_X.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT2_Y.DisplayName: 机身框架Y轴对罗盘2的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT2_Y.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT2_Z.DisplayName: 机身框架Z轴对罗盘2的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT2_Z.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT3_X.DisplayName: 机身框架X轴对罗盘3的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT3_X.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT3_Y.DisplayName: 机身框架Y轴对罗盘3的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT3_Y.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT3_Z.DisplayName: 机身框架Z轴对罗盘3的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT3_Z.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOTCT.Description: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

COMPASS_ODI_X.DisplayName: 指南针软铁非对角X分量
COMPASS_ODI_X.Description: 罗盘软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_X: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI_Y.DisplayName: 指南针软铁非对角Y分量
COMPASS_ODI_Y.Description: 罗盘软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Y: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI_Z.DisplayName: 指南针软铁非对角Z分量
COMPASS_ODI_Z.Description: 罗盘软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Z: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_X.DisplayName: 指南针2软铁非对角X分量
COMPASS_ODI2_X.Description: 罗盘2软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_X: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_Y.DisplayName: 指南针2软铁非对角Y分量
COMPASS_ODI2_Y.Description: 罗盘2软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Y: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_Z.DisplayName: 指南针2软铁非对角Z分量
COMPASS_ODI2_Z.Description: 罗盘2软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Z: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_X.DisplayName: 指南针3软铁非对角X分量
COMPASS_ODI3_X.Description: 罗盘3软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_X: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_Y.DisplayName: 指南针3软铁非对角Y分量
COMPASS_ODI3_Y.Description: 罗盘3软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Y: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_Z.DisplayName: 指南针3软铁非对角Z分量
COMPASS_ODI3_Z.Description: 罗盘3软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Z: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_OFFS_MAX.Description: 这将设置校准和解锁检查中允许的最大指南针偏移

COMPASS_OFS_X.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘X轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS_Y.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘Y轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS_Z.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘Z轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS2_X.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘2的X轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS2_Y.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘2的Y轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS2_Z.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘2的Z轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS3_X.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘3的X轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS3_Y.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘3的Y轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS3_Z.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘3的Z轴偏移值

COMPASS_OPTIONS.Description: 设置选项以更改指南针的数据源

COMPASS_ORIENT.Description: 外部罗盘1相对于机身框架的方向。 除非将此罗盘设置为外部罗盘，否则将忽略此值。 在指向北半球时，正确的设置应有将前方和右侧指向下方则分别增加MagX和MagY的值。 俯视逆时针旋转机身框架则会降低MagZ的值。 对于指向南半球，则数据相反。 注意：对于内部指南针，使用AHRS_ORIENT。

COMPASS_ORIENT2.Description: 外部罗盘2相对于机身框架的方向。 除非将此罗盘设置为外部罗盘，否则将忽略此值。 在指向北半球时，正确的设置应有将前方和右侧指向下方则分别增加MagX和MagY的值。 俯视逆时针旋转机身框架则会降低MagZ的值。 对于指向南半球，则数据相反。 注意：对于内部指南针，使用AHRS_ORIENT。

COMPASS_ORIENT3.Description: 外部罗盘3相对于机身框架的方向。 除非将此罗盘设置为外部罗盘，否则将忽略此值。 在指向北半球时，正确的设置应有将前方和右侧指向下方则分别增加MagX和MagY的值。 俯视逆时针旋转机身框架则会降低MagZ的值。 对于指向南半球，则数据相反。 注意：对于内部指南针，使用AHRS_ORIENT。

COMPASS_PMOT_EN.DisplayName: 电机独立罗盘校正启用
COMPASS_PMOT_EN.Description: 这可以实现每个电机单独对罗盘的校正

COMPASS_PMOT_EXP.Description: 用电机的输出功率值的指数对罗盘进行校正，这里调整的是指数系数。

COMPASS_PRIMARY.Description: If more than one compass is available, this selects which compass is the primary. When external compasses are connected, they will be ordered first. NOTE: If no external compass is attached, this parameter is ignored.

COMPASS_PRIO1_ID.DisplayName: 指南针设备ID具有一级优先级
COMPASS_PRIO1_ID.Description: 指南针设备ID具有一级优先级，如果设置为0，则会自动设置。更改后需要重新引导。

COMPASS_PRIO2_ID.DisplayName: 指南针设备ID具有第二优先级
COMPASS_PRIO2_ID.Description: 指南针设备ID具有第二优先级，如果设置为0，则会自动设置。更改后需要重新启动。

COMPASS_PRIO3_ID.DisplayName: 指南针设备ID具有第三优先级
COMPASS_PRIO3_ID.Description: 指南针设备ID具有第三优先级，如果设置为0，则会自动设置。更改后需要重新启动。

COMPASS_SCALE.Description: 第一个罗盘的比例因子，以补偿传感器的比例误差。 如果为0，则不进行缩放

COMPASS_SCALE2.Description: 第二个罗盘的比例因子，以补偿传感器的比例误差。 如果为0，则不进行缩放

COMPASS_SCALE3.Description: 第三个罗盘的比例因子，以补偿传感器的比例误差。 如果为0，则不进行缩放

COMPASS_TYPEMASK.DisplayName: 指南针禁用驱动程序类型掩码
COMPASS_TYPEMASK.Description: 这是要禁用的驱动程序类型的位掩码。 如果在此掩码中设置了驱动程序类型，则该驱动程序将不会在启动时尝试查找传感器。

COMPASS_USE.DisplayName: 使用指南针1来确定航向
COMPASS_USE.Description: 启用或禁用使用指南针1（而不是GPS）来确定航向

COMPASS_USE2.DisplayName: 使用指南针2来确定航向
COMPASS_USE2.Description: 启用或禁用使用指南针2（而不是GPS）来确定航向

COMPASS_USE3.DisplayName: 使用指南针3来确定航向
COMPASS_USE3.Description: 启用或禁用使用指南针3（而不是GPS）来确定航向

EK2_ABIAS_P_NSE.Description: This noise controls the growth of the vertical accelerometer delta velocity bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

EK2_ACC_P_NSE.Description: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.

EK2_ALT_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the baro measurement and will make the filter respond more slowly to baro measurement errors, but will make it more sensitive to GPS and accelerometer errors.

EK2_ALT_SOURCE.Description: Primary height sensor used by the EKF. If the selected option cannot be used, baro is used. 1 uses the range finder and only with optical flow navigation (EK2_GPS_TYPE = 3), Do not use "1" for terrain following. NOTE: the EK2_RNG_USE_HGT parameter can be used to switch to range-finder when close to the ground.
EK2_ALT_SOURCE.Values: 0:Use Baro, 1:Use Range Finder, 2:Use GPS, 3:Use Range Beacon

EK2_BCN_DELAY.DisplayName: 范围信标测量延迟（毫秒）
EK2_BCN_DELAY.Description: 这是距离信标测量值落后于惯性测量值的毫秒数。 它是从光流平均周期结束起的时间，不包括由于信号传输导致的平均100毫秒的时间延迟。

EK2_BCN_I_GTE.Description: 这将设置应用于范围信标测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK2_BCN_M_NSE.Description: 这是范围信标测量中噪声的RMS值。 增加它会减少此传感器的权重。

EK2_CHECK_SCALE.Description: 这会在EKF使用之前缩放用于检查GPS准确性的阈值。 默认值为100。 大于100的值会增加，小于100的值会减小EKF会接受的最大GPS错误。 值200将使GPS允许误差翻倍。

EK2_EAS_I_GATE.Description: 这将设置应用于空速测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK2_EAS_M_NSE.DisplayName: 等效空速测量噪声（m / s）
EK2_EAS_M_NSE.Description: 这是飞机在等效空速测量中的噪声RMS值。 增大它会降低空速测量的权重，并使风速估算值的噪声减小，收敛速度较慢。 如果在没有GPS测量值的情况下进行航迹推算，则增加它的值也会增加导航误差。

EK2_ENABLE.Description: 这将启用EKF2。 启用EKF2只会对传感器数据进行数学运算，并不意味着运算结果用于飞行控制。 要将其用于飞行控制，请设置AHRS_EKF_TYPE = 2。 更改EK2_ENABLE的值后，需要重新启动才能生效。

EK2_EXTNAV_DELAY.DisplayName: 外部导航系统测量延迟（毫秒）
EK2_EXTNAV_DELAY.Description: 这是外部导航系统测量值落后于惯性测量值的毫秒数。

EK2_FLOW_DELAY.Description: 这是光流测量值落后于惯性测量值的毫秒数。 它是从光流平均周期结束起的时间，不包括由于信号传输导致的平均100毫秒的时间延迟。

EK2_FLOW_I_GATE.Description: 这将设置应用于光流测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK2_FLOW_M_NSE.DisplayName: 光流传感器测量噪声（弧度/秒）
EK2_FLOW_M_NSE.Description: 这是光流传感器测量中噪声和误差的RMS值。 增加它可以减少传感器测量值的权重。

EK2_FLOW_USE.Description: 控制光流数据是融合到24状态导航估算器还是1状态地形高度估算器中。

EK2_GBIAS_P_NSE.DisplayName: 陀螺仪角加速度稳定度（rad / s^2）
EK2_GBIAS_P_NSE.Description: 该状态过程噪声控制了陀螺三轴偏角状态误差估计的增长。 增加它会使陀螺仪速率估计更快，但也更嘈杂。

EK2_GLITCH_RAD.Description: 在得到卫星定位之前，位置和速度由上一次的值经过惯导推算和滤波器滤波得到预测值，而这个设置值可帮助系统知道卫星定位的最大不确定半径，则当前精确位置在滤波器预测的值与卫星定位测量的值之间。 将此值设为较大时可以使滤波器忽略较大的卫星定位毛刺，但也意味着在得到新的卫星定位之前，IMU和罗盘等非GPS错误会在接下来的一次位置预测值上产生较大的误差。

EK2_GPS_CHECK.Description: 这是一个1字节的位图，用于控制执行哪些GPS飞行前检查。 设置为0绕过所有检查。 设置为255将执行所有检查。 设置为3仅检查卫星数和HDOP。 设置为31表示最严格的检查，当直升机移动（例如从船上发射）时，仍然允许检查通过。
EK2_GPS_CHECK.Bitmask: 0:有无卫星,1:HDOP,2:有无GPS速度,3:定位状态,4:航向,5:位置漂移,6:垂直速度,7:水平速度

EK2_GPS_TYPE.Description: 这可控制GPS测量值的使用：0 = 使用3D速度 & 2D位置，1 = 使用2D速度和2D位置，2 = 使用2D位置，3 = 弃用GPS的值-当在GPS质量较差且半径误差较大的环境中使用光流传感器进行飞行时这很有用。
EK2_GPS_TYPE.Values: 0:GPS三维速度和二维位置, 1:GPS二维速度和二维位置, 2:GPS二维位置, 3:弃用GPS

EK2_GSCL_P_NSE.DisplayName: 陀螺仪角速率稳定性因子（1 / s）
EK2_GSCL_P_NSE.Description: 该值控制着预测值的回归速度。增加该值会使预测值更贴近测量值，但也更嘈杂

EK2_GSF_DELAY.DisplayName: 从惯导丢失到航向重置的延迟
EK2_GSF_DELAY.Description: 如果惯性导航计算值停止跟随GPS和其他定位传感器的值并且时间超过EK2_GSF_DELAY毫秒，则EKF2代码将在内部生成一个重置请求，并将航向角重置为EKF-GSF滤波器的估算值，同时重置水平速度和GPS定位值。 除非通过EK2_GSF_USE参数启用了EKF-GSF航向估计值，否则不会执行此复位。

EK2_GSF_RST_MAX.DisplayName: EKF-GSF航向估计允许的最大重置次数
EK2_GSF_RST_MAX.Description: 将航向角重置为EKF-GSF滤波器估算值的最大次数。 除非通过EK2_GSF_USE参数启用了EKF-GSF航向估计，否则不允许进行任何复位。

EK2_GSF_RUN_MASK.DisplayName: 运行EKF-GSF航向估计器的位掩码
EK2_GSF_RUN_MASK.Description: 1字节的位图，其中的EKF2实例运行独立的EKF-GSF航向估计器，以提供不依赖于磁力计数据的备用偏航估计值。 该估算器使用IMU，GPS和空速数据（如果有）。 主要EKF2实例的EKF-GSF偏航估算器数据将记录为GSF0和GSF1消息。 由EK2_GSF_USE，EK2_GSF_DELAY和EK2_GSF_MAXCOUNT参数控制着该算法生成的偏航估计的使用场景。 若仅在行驶和记录中运行EKF-GSF偏航估计器，请将EK2_GSF_USE设置为0。
EK2_GSF_RUN_MASK.Bitmask: 0:第一EKF,1:第二EKF,2:第三EKF,3:第四EKF,4:第五EKF,5:第六EKF

EK2_GSF_USE_MASK.DisplayName: 使用EKF-GSF航向估计器的位掩码
EK2_GSF_USE_MASK.Description: 该设置组成的1字节位图，EKF2实例将使用由EK2_GSF_RUN参数打开的EKF-GSF偏航估计器的输出。如果惯性导航计算值与GPS做差发现惯导位置停止跟踪GPS，则自控代码可以请求EKF2尝试解决问题，方法是通过切换到另一个EKF2实例（如果该参数启用）来执行偏航重置。 另外，如果导航丢失的时间超过EK2_GSF_DELAY毫秒，则EKF2将在内部启动重置。
EK2_GSF_USE_MASK.Bitmask: 0:第一EKF,1:第二EKF,2:第三EKF,3:第四EKF,4:第五EKF,5:第六EKF

EK2_GYRO_P_NSE.DisplayName: 陀螺仪角速率噪声（rad / s）
EK2_GYRO_P_NSE.Description: 该值控制干扰噪声由于陀螺仪测量误差（不包括偏差）导致的估计误差的增长。 增加它会使颤振的系统对陀螺仪测量值的信任度降低，而对其他测量值的信任度的增高。

EK2_HGT_DELAY.Description: 这是高度测量值落后于惯性测量值的毫秒数。

EK2_HGT_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于高度测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK2_HRT_FILT.DisplayName: 高速率滤波器的交叉频率
EK2_HRT_FILT.Description: 指定用于计算输出预测值高度比率导数的互补滤波器的交叉频率。

EK2_IMU_MASK.Description: 在EKF2中使用的IMU的1字节位图。 对于每个选定的IMU，将启动EKF2的单独实例。 设置为1仅使用第一个IMU（默认），设置为2仅使用第二个IMU，设置为3以使用第一和第二个IMU。 如果内存和处理资源允许，最多可以使用6个附加IMU。 可能没有足够的内存和处理资源来运行多个实例。 如果发生这种情况，EKF2将无法启动。
EK2_IMU_MASK.Bitmask: 0:第一IMU,1:第二IMU,2:第三IMU,3:第四IMU,4:第五IMU,5:第六IMU

EK2_LOG_MASK.DisplayName: EKF传感器记录器记录的IMU掩码
EK2_LOG_MASK.Description: 这会将所选IMU传感器设置为完全记录
EK2_LOG_MASK.Bitmask: 0:第一IMU,1:第二IMU,2:第三IMU,3:第四IMU,4:第五IMU,5:第六IMU

EK2_MAG_CAL.Description: 这决定了滤波器将何时使用估计地球和机身框架固定磁场状态的3轴磁力计融合模型、何时使用更简单的磁场状态航向融合模型以及何时将使用替代方法以确定磁强计的航向计算值。三轴磁力计融合仅适用于外部磁场环境稳定的情况。EK3_MAG_CAL = 0 ：在地面上使用简易航向融合，在飞行中进行3轴融合，这是"飞机"用户的默认设置；EK3_MAG_CAL = 1 ：仅在操纵时使用3轴融合。EK3_MAG_CAL = 2 ：始终使用简易航向融合，建议在外部磁场变化的情况下使用，这是流动站的默认设置。EK3_MAG_CAL = 3 ：在第一个空中场和航向重置完成后，在地面使用简易航向融合，在空中使用3轴融合，这是直升机的默认设置。EK3_MAG_CAL = 4 ：始终使用3轴融合。注意：对于特定的EKF内核，可以使用EK2_MAG_MASK参数将融合模式强制为2。注意：通过将COMPASS_USE参数设置为0，可以在没有磁力计或任何其他偏航传感器的情况下进行有限的操作，如果这样做，则必须将EK2_GSF_RUN和EK2_GSF_USE掩码设置为与EK3_IMU_MASK相同。
EK2_MAG_CAL.Values: 0:飞行时,1:操纵时,2:从不,3:第一次爬升偏航复位后,4:总是

EK2_MAG_EF_LIM.Description: 这限制了学习到的地球磁场与世界磁场模型表中的差异。 零值表示禁用WMM表。

EK2_MAG_I_GATE.DisplayName: 磁场航向测量值可信度
EK2_MAG_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于磁场航向测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK2_MAG_M_NSE.Description: 这是磁场计测量中噪声的RMS值。 增加它会减少这些测量值的权重。

EK2_MAG_MASK.DisplayName: 始终使用简易航向融合的活动EKF内核的位掩码
EK2_MAG_MASK.Description: EKF内核的1字节位图，将始终禁用三轴磁力计融合并使用简单的磁航向融合。此参数使指定的磁场传感器可用作备用设备，以飞入具有强外部磁干扰的环境中，这在使用3轴磁力计融合时可能会降低EKF姿态估计值的精确度。 注意：在不同的磁场传感器上使用不同的磁强计融合算法会出现由于磁强计误差引起的EKF核心切换。
EK2_MAG_MASK.Bitmask: 0:第一EKF,1:第二EKF,2:第三EKF,3:第四EKF,4:第五EKF,5:第六EKF

EK2_MAGB_P_NSE.DisplayName: 本体磁场过程噪声（高斯/秒）
EK2_MAGB_P_NSE.Description: 这种状态过程噪声控制着本体磁场状态误差估计的增长。 增加它会使磁力计偏置误差估计更快但也更嘈杂。

EK2_MAGE_P_NSE.DisplayName: 地磁场过程噪声（高斯/秒）
EK2_MAGE_P_NSE.Description: 该状态过程噪声控制着地球磁场状态误差估计的增长。 增加它可以使地球磁场估计更快但也更嘈杂。

EK2_MAX_FLOW.Description: 这将设置滤光器可接受的最大光流速率幅度（以弧度/秒为单位）

EK2_NOAID_M_NSE.DisplayName: 非GPS操作下的位置不确定度（m）
EK2_NOAID_M_NSE.Description: 这设置了在没有外部测量（例如GPS或光流）的情况下EKF允许的位置变化量。增加此参数会使EKF姿态估计值对飞行器操纵的敏感性降低，但对IMU错误的敏感性更高。

EK2_OGN_HGT_MASK.DisplayName: EKF参考高度校正的位掩码控制
EK2_OGN_HGT_MASK.Description: 当EKF将GPS以外的其他高度传感器用作主要高度源时，零高度基准的位置由该传感器及其参考系定义。如果还可以使用GPS高度测量，则可以校正EKF使用的WGS-84高度基准的高度，以便补偿getLLH（）函数返回的高度以补偿主要高度传感器的漂移和基准随时间的变化 。前两位控制何时校正高度基准。 校正使用贝叶斯滤波器执行，并且仅在允许的GPS定位质量的情况下运行。第三位位置控制在何处应用GPS参考数据的校正。 可以将校正应用于局部垂直位置或所报告的EKF原点高度（默认值）。
EK2_OGN_HGT_MASK.Bitmask: 0:使用气压高度时更正,1:使用测距仪高度时更正,2:将更正应用于本地位置

EK2_POS_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于GPS位置测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK2_POSNE_M_NSE.Description: 这将设置GPS水平位置或外部导航系统位置的观察噪声。增加它会减少GPS水平位置或外部导航系统位置测量的权重。

EK2_RNG_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于测距仪测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK2_RNG_M_NSE.Description: 这是测距仪测量中噪声的RMS值。 增加它会减少此度量的权重。

EK2_RNG_USE_HGT.DisplayName: 测距仪开关高度百分比
EK2_RNG_USE_HGT.Description: 低于最大范围（请参见RNGFND_MAX_CM）的此百分比时，可以将测距仪用作主要的高度源。未将EK2_ALT_SOURCE设置为测距仪时该设置值为-1。这不适用于地形跟踪。

EK2_RNG_USE_SPD.DisplayName: 测距仪正常工作允许的最大地面速度
EK2_RNG_USE_SPD.Description: 当水平地面速度大于此值时，测距仪将不会用作主要的高度来源。

EK2_TAU_OUTPUT.DisplayName: 输出互补滤波器时间常数（厘秒，0.01s）
EK2_TAU_OUTPUT.Description: 设置输出互补滤波器/预测器的时间常数（以厘秒为单位，0.01s）。

EK2_TERR_GRAD.Description: 指定在将测距仪或光流融合以估计地形高度时假定的机身框架下方地形的最大坡度。

EK2_VEL_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于GPS速度测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK2_VELD_M_NSE.DisplayName: GPS垂直速度测量噪声（m / s）
EK2_VELD_M_NSE.Description: 这将设置GPS接收器报告的速度精度的下限，该下限用于设置垂直速度观测噪声。如果所使用的接收器模型未提供速度精确估计，则将使用参数值。 增加它会减少GPS垂直速度测量的权重。

EK2_VELNE_M_NSE.DisplayName: GPS水平速度测量噪声（m / s）
EK2_VELNE_M_NSE.Description: 这设置了由GPS接收器报告的速度精度的下限，该速度精度用于设置水平速度观测噪声。 如果所使用的接收器模型未提供速度精确估计，则将使用参数值。 增加它可以减少GPS水平速度测量的权重。

EK2_WIND_P_NSE.Description: 这种状态过程噪声控制着风态误差估计的增长。 增加它可以使风速估算更快但也更嘈杂。

EK2_WIND_PSCALE.DisplayName: 风程噪声缩放器的高度比率
EK2_WIND_PSCALE.Description: 这可以控制在增加或降低高度时，考虑到风速和风向随高度的变化，在风状态下过程噪声会增加多少。增大此参数会增加在更改高度时风态适应的速度，但确实会使风速估计值降低。

EK2_YAW_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于航向测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK2_YAW_M_NSE.Description: 这是磁力计在航向测量中的噪声RMS值。 增加它可以减少这些测量值的权重。

EK3_ABIAS_P_NSE.DisplayName: 加速度计偏差稳定性（m / s ^ 3）
EK3_ABIAS_P_NSE.Description: 该噪声控制垂直加速度计增量速度偏差状态误差估计的增长。 增加它可以使加速度计偏差估计更快但也更嘈杂。

EK3_ACC_BIAS_LIM.Description: 加速度计的偏差状态将限制为±此值

EK3_ACC_P_NSE.Description: 该控制干扰噪声控制着加速度计测量误差（不包括偏差）引起的估计误差的增长。 增加它可以使姿态估算器对加速度计的信任度减少，而对其他测量值的信任更高。

EK3_ALT_M_NSE.Description: 这是海拔高度测量中噪声的RMS值。 增大它可以减少气压测量的权重，并使滤波器对气压测量误差的响应更慢，但对GPS和加速度计误差更敏感。

EK3_ALT_SOURCE.DisplayName: 主高度传感器数据来源
EK3_ALT_SOURCE.Description: EKF使用的主要高度传感器。 如果无法使用所选选项，则使用baro。1使用测距仪，并且仅用于光流导航（EK3_GPS_TYPE = 3），请勿在地形跟踪中使用" 1"。注意：EK3_RNG_USE_HGT参数可以在靠近地面时切换到测距仪。设置4使用外部导航系统数据，但仅当数据也用于水平位置时。
EK3_ALT_SOURCE.Values: 0:使用气压计, 1:使用测距仪, 2:使用GPS, 3:使用范围信标, 4:使用外部导航数据

EK3_BCN_DELAY.DisplayName: 范围信标测量延迟（毫秒）
EK3_BCN_DELAY.Description: 这是距离信标测量值落后于惯性测量值的毫秒数。

EK3_BCN_I_GTE.DisplayName: 范围信标测量值可信度
EK3_BCN_I_GTE.Description: 此设置应用于范围信标测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK3_BCN_M_NSE.DisplayName: 范围信标位置测量的噪声（米）
EK3_BCN_M_NSE.Description: 这是范围信标位置测量中噪声的RMS值。 增加它会减少此度量的权重。

EK3_CHECK_SCALE.Description: 这会在EKF使用之前缩放用于检查GPS准确性的阈值。默认值为100。 大于100的值会增加，小于100的值会减小EKF会接受的最大GPS错误。值200将使GPS允许误差翻倍。

EK3_EAS_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于空速测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK3_EAS_M_NSE.DisplayName: 等效空速测量噪声（m / s）
EK3_EAS_M_NSE.Description: 这是飞机在等效空速测量中的噪声RMS值。 增大它会降低空速测量的权重，并使风速估算值的噪声较小，收敛速度较慢。 如果在没有GPS测量值的情况下进行航迹推算，则增加也会增加导航误差。

EK3_ENABLE.Description: 这将启用EKF3。 启用EKF3只会使数学运行，并不意味着它将用于飞行控制。 要将其用于飞行控制，请设置AHRS_EKF_TYPE = 3。 更改EK3_ENABLE的值后，重新启动才能生效。

EK3_FLOW_DELAY.Description: 这是光流测量值落后于惯性测量值的毫秒数。 它是从光流平均周期结束起的时间，不包括由于信号传输导致的平均100毫秒的时间延迟。

EK3_FLOW_I_GATE.Description: 这将设置应用于光流测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK3_FLOW_M_NSE.DisplayName: 光流传感器测量噪声（弧度/秒）
EK3_FLOW_M_NSE.Description: 这是光流传感器测量中噪声和误差的RMS值。 增加它可以减少传感器测量值的权重。

EK3_FLOW_USE.Description: 控制光流数据是融合到24状态导航估算器还是1状态地形高度估算器中。

EK3_GBIAS_P_NSE.DisplayName: 陀螺仪角加速度稳定度（rad / s^2）
EK3_GBIAS_P_NSE.Description: 该状态过程噪声控制了陀螺三轴偏角状态误差估计的增长。 增加它会使陀螺仪速率估计更快，但也更嘈杂。

EK3_GLITCH_RAD.Description: 在得到卫星定位之前，位置和速度由上一次的值经过惯导推算和滤波器滤波得到预测值，而这个设置值可帮助系统知道卫星定位的最大不确定半径，则当前精确位置在滤波器预测的值与卫星定位测量的值之间。 将此值设为较大时可以使滤波器忽略较大的卫星定位毛刺，但也意味着在得到新的卫星定位之前，IMU和罗盘等非GPS错误会在接下来的一次位置预测值上产生较大的误差。

EK3_GPS_CHECK.Description: 这是一个1字节的位图，用于控制执行哪些GPS飞行前检查。 设置为0绕过所有检查。 设置为255将执行所有检查。 设置为3仅检查卫星数和HDOP。 设置为31表示最严格的检查，当直升机移动（例如从船上发射）时，仍然允许检查通过。
EK3_GPS_CHECK.Bitmask: 0:有无卫星,1:HDOP,2:有无GPS速度,3:定位状态,4:航向,5:位置漂移,6:垂直速度,7:水平速度

EK3_GPS_TYPE.Description: 这可控制GPS测量值的使用：0 = 使用3D速度 & 2D位置，1 = 使用2D速度和2D位置，2 = 使用2D位置，3 = 弃用GPS的值-当在GPS质量较差且半径误差较大的环境中使用光流传感器进行飞行时这很有用。
EK3_GPS_TYPE.Values: 0:GPS三维速度和二维位置, 1:GPS二维速度和二维位置, 2:GPS二维位置, 3:弃用GPS

EK3_GSF_DELAY.DisplayName: 从惯导丢失到航向重置的延迟
EK3_GSF_DELAY.Description: 如果惯性导航计算值停止跟随GPS和其他定位传感器的值并且时间超过EK3_GSF_DELAY毫秒，则EKF3代码将在内部生成一个重置请求，并将航向角重置为EKF-GSF滤波器的估算值，同时重置水平速度和GPS定位值。 除非通过EK3_GSF_USE参数启用了EKF-GSF航向估计值，否则不会执行此复位。

EK3_GSF_RST_MAX.DisplayName: EKF-GSF航向估计允许的最大重置次数
EK3_GSF_RST_MAX.Description: 将航向角重置为EKF-GSF滤波器估算值的最大次数。 除非通过EK3_GSF_USE参数启用了EKF-GSF航向估计，否则不允许进行任何复位。

EK3_GSF_RUN_MASK.DisplayName: 运行EKF-GSF航向估计器的位掩码
EK3_GSF_RUN_MASK.Description: 1字节的位图，其中的EKF3实例运行独立的EKF-GSF航向估计器，以提供不依赖于磁力计数据的备用偏航估计值。 该估算器使用IMU，GPS和空速数据（如果有）。 主要EKF3实例的EKF-GSF偏航估算器数据将记录为GSF0和GSF1消息。 由EK3_GSF_USE，EK3_GSF_DELAY和EK3_GSF_MAXCOUNT参数控制着该算法生成的偏航估计的使用场景。 若仅在行驶和记录中运行EKF-GSF偏航估计器，请将EK3_GSF_USE设置为0。
EK3_GSF_RUN_MASK.Bitmask: 0:第一EKF,1:第二EKF,2:第三EKF,3:第四EKF,4:第五EKF,5:第六EKF

EK3_GSF_USE_MASK.DisplayName: 使用EKF-GSF航向估计器的位掩码
EK3_GSF_USE_MASK.Description: 该设置组成的1字节位图，EKF3实例将使用由EK3_GSF_RUN参数打开的EKF-GSF偏航估计器的输出。如果惯性导航计算值与GPS做差发现惯导位置停止跟踪GPS，则自控代码可以请求EKF3尝试解决问题，方法是通过切换到另一个EKF3实例（如果该参数启用）来执行偏航重置。 另外，如果导航丢失的时间超过EK3_GSF_DELAY毫秒，则EKF3将在内部启动重置。
EK3_GSF_USE_MASK.Bitmask: 0:第一EKF,1:第二EKF,2:第三EKF,3:第四EKF,4:第五EKF,5:第六EKF

EK3_GYRO_P_NSE.DisplayName: 陀螺仪角速率噪声（rad / s）
EK3_GYRO_P_NSE.Description: 该值控制干扰噪声由于陀螺仪测量误差（不包括偏差）导致的估计误差的增长。 增加它会使颤振的系统对陀螺仪测量值的信任度降低，而对其他测量值的信任度的增高。

EK3_HGT_DELAY.Description: 这是高度测量值落后于惯性测量值的毫秒数。

EK3_HGT_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于高度测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK3_HRT_FILT.DisplayName: 高速率滤波器的交叉频率
EK3_HRT_FILT.Description: 指定用于计算输出预测值高度比率导数的互补滤波器的交叉频率。

EK3_IMU_MASK.Description: 在EKF2中使用的IMU的1字节位图。 对于每个选定的IMU，将启动EKF2的单独实例。 设置为1仅使用第一个IMU（默认），设置为2仅使用第二个IMU，设置为3以使用第一和第二个IMU。 如果内存和处理资源允许，最多可以使用6个附加IMU。 可能没有足够的内存和处理资源来运行多个实例。 如果发生这种情况，EKF2将无法启动。
EK3_IMU_MASK.Bitmask: 0:第一IMU,1:第二IMU,2:第三IMU,3:第四IMU,4:第五IMU,5:第六IMU

EK3_LOG_MASK.DisplayName: EKF传感器记录器记录的IMU掩码
EK3_LOG_MASK.Description: 这会将所选IMU传感器设置为完全记录
EK3_LOG_MASK.Bitmask: 0:第一IMU,1:第二IMU,2:第三IMU,3:第四IMU,4:第五IMU,5:第六IMU

EK3_MAG_CAL.Description: 这决定了滤波器将何时使用估计地球和机身框架固定磁场状态的3轴磁力计融合模型、何时使用更简单的磁场状态航向融合模型以及何时将使用替代方法以确定磁强计的航向计算值。三轴磁力计融合仅适用于外部磁场环境稳定的情况。EK3_MAG_CAL = 0 ：在地面上使用简易航向融合，在飞行中进行3轴融合，这是"飞机"用户的默认设置；EK3_MAG_CAL = 1 ：仅在操纵时使用3轴融合。EK3_MAG_CAL = 2 ：始终使用简易航向融合，建议在外部磁场变化的情况下使用，这是流动站的默认设置。EK3_MAG_CAL = 3 ：在第一个空中场和航向重置完成后，在地面使用简易航向融合，在空中使用3轴融合，这是直升机的默认设置。EK3_MAG_CAL = 4 ：始终使用3轴融合。注意：对于特定的EKF内核，可以使用EK3_MAG_MASK参数将融合模式强制为2。注意：通过将COMPASS_USE参数设置为0，可以在没有磁力计或任何其他偏航传感器的情况下进行有限的操作，如果这样做，则必须将EK3_GSF_RUN和EK3_GSF_USE掩码设置为与EK3_IMU_MASK相同。
EK3_MAG_CAL.Values: 0:飞行时,1:操纵时,2:从不,3:第一次爬升偏航复位后,4:总是,5:使用外部偏航传感器,6:带备用指南针的外部偏航传感器,7:使用GSF偏航估算

EK3_MAG_EF_LIM.Description: 这限制了学习到的地球磁场与世界磁场模型表中的差异。 零值表示禁用WMM表。

EK3_MAG_I_GATE.DisplayName: 磁场航向测量值可信度
EK3_MAG_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于磁场航向测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK3_MAG_M_NSE.Description: 这是磁场计测量中噪声的RMS值。 增加它会减少这些测量值的权重。

EK3_MAG_MASK.DisplayName: 始终使用简易航向融合的活动EKF内核的位掩码
EK3_MAG_MASK.Description: EKF内核的1字节位图，将始终禁用三轴磁力计融合并使用简单的磁航向融合。此参数使指定的磁场传感器可用作备用设备，以飞入具有强外部磁干扰的环境中，这在使用3轴磁力计融合时可能会降低EKF姿态估计值的精确度。 注意：在不同的磁场传感器上使用不同的磁强计融合算法会出现由于磁强计误差引起的EKF核心切换。
EK3_MAG_MASK.Bitmask: 0:第一EKF,1:第二EKF,2:第三EKF,3:第四EKF,4:第五EKF,5:第六EKF

EK3_MAGB_P_NSE.DisplayName: 本体磁场过程噪声（高斯/秒）
EK3_MAGB_P_NSE.Description: 这种状态过程噪声控制着本体磁场状态误差估计的增长。 增加它会使磁力计偏置误差估计更快但也更嘈杂。

EK3_MAGE_P_NSE.DisplayName: 地磁场过程噪声（高斯/秒）
EK3_MAGE_P_NSE.Description: 该状态过程噪声控制着地球磁场状态误差估计的增长。 增加它可以使地球磁场估计更快但也更嘈杂。

EK3_MAX_FLOW.Description: 这将设置滤光器可接受的最大光流速率幅度（以弧度/秒为单位）

EK3_NOAID_M_NSE.DisplayName: 非GPS操作下的位置不确定度（m）
EK3_NOAID_M_NSE.Description: 这设置了在没有外部测量（例如GPS或光流）的情况下EKF允许的位置变化量。增加此参数会使EKF姿态估计值对飞行器操纵的敏感性降低，但对IMU错误的敏感性更高。

EK3_OGN_HGT_MASK.DisplayName: EKF参考高度校正的位掩码控制
EK3_OGN_HGT_MASK.Description: 当EKF将GPS以外的其他高度传感器用作主要高度源时，零高度基准的位置由该传感器及其参考系定义。如果还可以使用GPS高度测量，则可以校正EKF使用的WGS-84高度基准的高度，以便补偿getLLH（）函数返回的高度以补偿主要高度传感器的漂移和基准随时间的变化 。前两位控制何时校正高度基准。 校正使用贝叶斯滤波器执行，并且仅在允许的GPS定位质量的情况下运行。第三位位置控制在何处应用GPS参考数据的校正。 可以将校正应用于局部垂直位置或所报告的EKF原点高度（默认值）。
EK3_OGN_HGT_MASK.Bitmask: 0:使用气压高度时更正,1:使用测距仪高度时更正,2:将更正应用于本地位置

EK3_POS_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于GPS位置测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK3_POSNE_M_NSE.Description: 这将设置GPS水平位置或外部导航系统位置的观察噪声。增加它会减少GPS水平位置或外部导航系统位置测量的权重。

EK3_RNG_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于测距仪测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK3_RNG_M_NSE.Description: 这是测距仪测量中噪声的RMS值。 增加它会减少此度量的权重。

EK3_RNG_USE_HGT.DisplayName: 测距仪开关高度百分比
EK3_RNG_USE_HGT.Description: 低于最大范围（请参见RNGFND_MAX_CM）的此百分比时，可以将测距仪用作主要的高度源。未将EK2_ALT_SOURCE设置为测距仪时该设置值为-1。这不适用于地形跟踪。

EK3_RNG_USE_SPD.DisplayName: 测距仪正常工作允许的最大地面速度
EK3_RNG_USE_SPD.Description: 当水平地面速度大于此值时，测距仪将不会用作主要的高度来源。

EK3_TAU_OUTPUT.DisplayName: 输出互补滤波器时间常数（厘秒，0.01s）
EK3_TAU_OUTPUT.Description: 设置输出互补滤波器/预测器的时间常数（以厘秒为单位，0.01s）。

EK3_TERR_GRAD.Description: 指定在将测距仪或光流融合以估计地形高度时假定的机身框架下方地形的最大坡度。

EK3_VEL_I_GATE.Description: 此设置应用于GPS速度测量值的标准偏差百分比。降低它的值可能使良好的测量数据被拒绝，而增加它也可能会使不良测量数据进入。

EK3_VELD_M_NSE.DisplayName: GPS垂直速度测量噪声（m / s）
EK3_VELD_M_NSE.Description: 这将设置GPS接收器报告的速度精度的下限，该下限用于设置垂直速度观测噪声。如果所使用的接收器模型未提供速度精确估计，则将使用参数值。 增加它会减少GPS垂直速度测量的权重。

EK3_VELNE_M_NSE.DisplayName: GPS水平速度测量噪声（m / s）
EK3_VELNE_M_NSE.Description: 这设置了由GPS接收器报告的速度精度的下限，该速度精度用于设置水平速度观测噪声。 如果所使用的接收器模型未提供速度精确估计，则将使用参数值。 增加它可以减少GPS水平速度测量的权重。

EK3_VIS_VERR_MAX.DisplayName: 视觉里程表最大速度误差
EK3_VIS_VERR_MAX.Description: 这是传感器报告最低质量时将假定的1-STD里程表速度观测误差。 当质量介于最大值和最小值之间时，将使用VIS_VERR_MIN和VIS_VERR_MAX之间的线性插值来计算误差。

EK3_VIS_VERR_MIN.DisplayName: 视觉里程表最小速度误差
