SURFACE_DEPTH.Description: The depth the external pressure sensor will read when the vehicle is considered at the surface (in centimeters)

SYSID_MYGCS.Description: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

SYSID_SW_MREV.Description: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

SYSID_THISMAV.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
SYSID_THISMAV.Description: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

TERRAIN_ENABLE.Description: enable terrain data. This enables the vehicle storing a database of terrain data on the SD card. The terrain data is requested from the ground station as needed, and stored for later use on the SD card. To be useful the ground station must support TERRAIN_REQUEST messages and have access to a terrain database, such as the SRTM database.

TERRAIN_FOLLOW.Description: This enables terrain following for RTL and SURFACE flight modes. To use this option TERRAIN_ENABLE must be 1 and the GCS must support sending terrain data to the aircraft. In RTL the RTL_ALT will be considered a height above the terrain. In LAND mode the vehicle will slow to LAND_SPEED 10m above terrain (instead of 10m above home). This parameter does not affect AUTO and Guided which use a per-command flag to determine if the height is above-home, absolute or above-terrain.
TERRAIN_FOLLOW.Values: 0:Do Not Use in RTL and SURFACE,1:Use in RTL and SURFACE

TERRAIN_OPTIONS.Description: Options to change behaviour of terrain system

TERRAIN_SPACING.Description: Distance between terrain grid points in meters. This controls the horizontal resolution of the terrain data that is stored on te SD card and requested from the ground station. If your GCS is using the worldwide SRTM database then a resolution of 100 meters is appropriate. Some parts of the world may have higher resolution data available, such as 30 meter data available in the SRTM database in the USA. The grid spacing also controls how much data is kept in memory during flight. A larger grid spacing will allow for a larger amount of data in memory. A grid spacing of 100 meters results in the vehicle keeping 12 grid squares in memory with each grid square having a size of 2.7 kilometers by 3.2 kilometers. Any additional grid squares are stored on the SD once they are fetched from the GCS and will be demand loaded as needed.

THR_DZ.Description: The PWM deadzone in microseconds above and below mid throttle. Used in AltHold, Loiter, PosHold flight modes

WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR.Description: Determines how the autopilot controls the yaw during missions and RTL
WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR.Values: 0:Never change yaw, 1:Face next waypoint, 2:Face next waypoint except RTL, 3:Face along GPS course, 4:Correct crosstrack error

WPNAV_ACCEL.Description: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

WPNAV_ACCEL_Z.Description: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

WPNAV_RADIUS.Description: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

WPNAV_RFND_USE.DisplayName: Waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following
WPNAV_RFND_USE.Description: This controls if waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following

WPNAV_SPEED.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

WPNAV_SPEED_DN.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

WPNAV_SPEED_UP.Description: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

XTRACK_ANG_LIM.Description: Maximum allowed angle (in degrees) between current track and desired heading during waypoint navigation

AHRS_COMP_BETA.DisplayName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
AHRS_COMP_BETA.Description: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT.Description: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL.Description: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW.Description: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_EKF_TYPE.DisplayName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
AHRS_EKF_TYPE.Description: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.Description: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_MINSATS.Description: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

AHRS_GPS_USE.Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS whenever it is available.

AHRS_ORIENTATION.Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

AHRS_RP_P.Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_TRIM_X.Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

AHRS_TRIM_Y.Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

AHRS_WIND_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

AHRS_YAW_P.Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

ALT_SOURCE.Description: What provides altitude information for vehicle. Vehicle only assumes tracker has same altitude as vehicle's home

BATT_AMP_OFFSET.Description: 电池1电流传感器零电流时的数值偏移

BATT_AMP_PERVLT.Description: 电池1电流传感器上1V读数所对应的安培数。 对于使用3DR Power版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。对于使用3DR 4in1 ESC版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。

BATT_ARM_MAH.DisplayName: 解锁所需电池1剩余电量
BATT_ARM_MAH.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池1的剩余电量。设置为0可在任何剩余容量下解锁飞机。 请注意，除了智能电池重新启动之外，飞机始终会重置剩余电量估算值，这可能会导致此检查无法提供足够的保护，建议始终将此功能与以下功能结合使用：@

BATT_ARM_VOLT.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池1的电压。设置为0允许在任何电压下解锁。

BATT_BUS.DisplayName: 电池1监控器的I2C总线编号
BATT_BUS.Description: 电池1监控器的I2C总线编号。

BATT_CAPACITY.Description: 电池1的总容量（以mAh为单位）

BATT_CRT_MAH.Description: 触发低电量保护的电池1的电池容量。设置为0可禁用低电量保护功能。 如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT_CRT_VOLT.Description: 触发电池1的低电压故障保护的电压值。设置为0则禁用。 如果电池电压持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT_CURR_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电池1电流监控的模拟输入引脚。

BATT_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: 遇到电池1故障，飞机应采取的措施。

BATT_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: 电池1电量不足时，飞机应采取什么措施。

BATT_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: 用于检测电池1电压的算法
BATT_FS_VOLTSRC.Values: 0:原始电压数据, 1:凹陷补偿电压

BATT_LOW_MAH.Description: 触发电池1低电量的电池容量。 设置为0可禁用电池低电量保护功能。如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT_LOW_TIMER.Description: 这是触发电池1低电压事件之前的延时时间（以秒为单位）。对于具有低C电池的飞机，可能有必要将延时调长，以应对加速或起飞时的瞬时压降。 ‘0’值将不启用此功能。

BATT_LOW_VOLT.Description: 触发电池低电量保护动作的电池电压。 设置为0则禁用。如果电池电压连续持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT_MONITOR.Description: 通过控件可以监视电池的电压和电流
BATT_MONITOR.Values: 0:不允许,3:仅ADC电压,4:ADC电压和电流,5:单口,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Maxell,8:UAVCAN-电池信息,9:BLHeli ESC回传（DShot）,10:SumOfFollowing,11:FuelFlow,12:燃油水平PWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign

BATT_SERIAL_NUM.Description: 自动为SMBus电池填写的电池序列号，否则为-1。 对于UAVCAN，它是battery_id。

BATT_VOLT_MULT.Description: 用于转换感应引脚的电压(@

BATT_VOLT_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电压监视的模拟输入引脚。

BATT_WATT_MAX.Description: 如果电池输出瓦数（电压*电流）超过此值，则系统将减小油门（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）以满足此限制。 这有助于在使用低倍率电池的飞机上安全的飞行，而不管电池电压如何。 当实际电流小于了最大电流值 且 实际功率低于了最大功率值，则各油门限制将缓慢增长回原始设置值（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）。 ‘0’禁用。

BATT2_AMP_OFFSET.Description: 电池2电流传感器零电流时的数值偏移

BATT2_AMP_PERVLT.Description: 电池2电流传感器上1V读数所对应的安培数。 对于使用3DR Power版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。对于使用3DR 4in1 ESC版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。

BATT2_ARM_MAH.DisplayName: 解锁所需电池2剩余电量
BATT2_ARM_MAH.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池2的剩余电量。设置为0可在任何剩余容量下解锁飞机。 请注意，除了智能电池重新启动之外，飞机始终会重置剩余电量估算值，这可能会导致此检查无法提供足够的保护，建议始终将此功能与以下功能结合使用：@

BATT2_ARM_VOLT.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池2的电压。设置为0允许在任何电压下解锁。

BATT2_BUS.DisplayName: 电池2监控器的I2C总线编号
BATT2_BUS.Description: 电池2监控器的I2C总线编号。

BATT2_CAPACITY.Description: 电池2的总容量（以mAh为单位）

BATT2_CRT_MAH.Description: 触发低电量保护的电池2的电池容量。设置为0可禁用低电量保护功能。 如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT2_CRT_VOLT.Description: 触发电池2的低电压故障保护的电压值。设置为0则禁用。 如果电池电压持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT2_CURR_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电池2电流监控的模拟输入引脚。

BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: 遇到电池2故障，飞机应采取的措施。

BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: 电池2电量不足时，飞机应采取什么措施。

BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: 用于检测电池2电压的算法
BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC.Values: 0:原始电压数据, 1:凹陷补偿电压

BATT2_LOW_MAH.Description: 触发电池2低电量的电池容量。 设置为0可禁用电池低电量保护功能。如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT2_LOW_TIMER.Description: 这是触发电池2低电压事件之前的延时时间（以秒为单位）。对于具有低C电池的飞机，可能有必要将延时调长，以应对加速或起飞时的瞬时压降。 ‘0’值将不启用此功能。

BATT2_LOW_VOLT.Description: 触发电池2的低电压故障保护的电压值。设置为0则禁用。 如果电池电压持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT2_MONITOR.Description: 通过控件可以监视电池的电压和电流
BATT2_MONITOR.Values: 0:不允许,3:仅ADC电压,4:ADC电压和电流,5:单口,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Maxell,8:UAVCAN-电池信息,9:BLHeli ESC回传（DShot）,10:SumOfFollowing,11:FuelFlow,12:燃油水平PWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign

BATT2_SERIAL_NUM.Description: 自动为SMBus电池填写的电池序列号，否则为-1。 对于UAVCAN，它是battery_id。

BATT2_VOLT_MULT.Description: 用于转换感应引脚的电压(@

BATT2_VOLT_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电压监视的模拟输入引脚。

BATT2_WATT_MAX.Description: 如果电池输出瓦数（电压*电流）超过此值，则系统将减小油门（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）以满足此限制。 这有助于在使用低倍率电池的飞机上安全的飞行，而不管电池电压如何。 当实际电流小于了最大电流值 且 实际功率低于了最大功率值，则各油门限制将缓慢增长回原始设置值（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）。 ‘0’禁用。

BATT3_AMP_OFFSET.Description: 电池3电流传感器零电流时的数值偏移

BATT3_AMP_PERVLT.Description: 电池3电流传感器上1V读数所对应的安培数。 对于使用3DR Power版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。对于使用3DR 4in1 ESC版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。

BATT3_ARM_MAH.DisplayName: 解锁所需电池3剩余电量
BATT3_ARM_MAH.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池3的剩余电量。设置为0可在任何剩余容量下解锁飞机。 请注意，除了智能电池重新启动之外，飞机始终会重置剩余电量估算值，这可能会导致此检查无法提供足够的保护，建议始终将此功能与以下功能结合使用：@

BATT3_ARM_VOLT.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池3的电压。设置为0允许在任何电压下解锁。

BATT3_BUS.DisplayName: 电池3监控器的I2C总线编号
BATT3_BUS.Description: 电池3监控器的I2C总线编号。

BATT3_CAPACITY.Description: 电池3的总容量（以mAh为单位）

BATT3_CRT_MAH.Description: 触发低电量保护的电池3的电池容量。设置为0可禁用低电量保护功能。 如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT3_CRT_VOLT.Description: 触发电池3的低电压故障保护的电压值。设置为0则禁用。 如果电池电压持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT3_CURR_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电池3电流监控的模拟输入引脚。

BATT3_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: 遇到电池3故障，飞机应采取的措施。

BATT3_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: 电池3电量不足时，飞机应采取什么措施。

BATT3_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: 用于检测电池3电压的算法
BATT3_FS_VOLTSRC.Values: 0:原始电压数据, 1:凹陷补偿电压

BATT3_LOW_MAH.Description: 触发电池3低电量的电池容量。 设置为0可禁用电池低电量保护功能。如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT3_LOW_TIMER.Description: 这是触发电池3低电压事件之前的延时时间（以秒为单位）。对于具有低C电池的飞机，可能有必要将延时调长，以应对加速或起飞时的瞬时压降。 ‘0’值将不启用此功能。

BATT3_LOW_VOLT.Description: 触发电池3的低电压故障保护的电压值。设置为0则禁用。 如果电池电压持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT3_MONITOR.Description: 通过控件可以监视电池的电压和电流
BATT3_MONITOR.Values: 0:不允许,3:仅ADC电压,4:ADC电压和电流,5:单口,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Maxell,8:UAVCAN-电池信息,9:BLHeli ESC回传（DShot）,10:SumOfFollowing,11:FuelFlow,12:燃油水平PWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign

BATT3_VOLT_MULT.Description: 用于转换感应引脚的电压(@

BATT3_VOLT_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电压监视的模拟输入引脚。

BATT7_LOW_VOLT.Description: 触发电池7的低电压故障保护的电压值。设置为0则禁用。 如果电池电压持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT7_MONITOR.Description: 通过控件可以监视电池的电压和电流
BATT7_MONITOR.Values: 0:不允许,3:仅ADC电压,4:ADC电压和电流,5:单口,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Maxell,8:UAVCAN-电池信息,9:BLHeli ESC回传（DShot）,10:SumOfFollowing,11:FuelFlow,12:燃油水平PWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign

BATT7_SERIAL_NUM.Description: 自动为SMBus电池填写的电池序列号，否则为-1。 对于UAVCAN，它是battery_id。

BATT7_VOLT_MULT.Description: 用于转换感应引脚的电压(@

BATT7_VOLT_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电压监视的模拟输入引脚。

BATT7_WATT_MAX.Description: 如果电池输出瓦数（电压*电流）超过此值，则系统将减小油门（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）以满足此限制。 这有助于在使用低倍率电池的飞机上安全的飞行，而不管电池电压如何。 当实际电流小于了最大电流值 且 实际功率低于了最大功率值，则各油门限制将缓慢增长回原始设置值（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）。 ‘0’禁用。

BATT8_AMP_OFFSET.Description: 电池8电流传感器零电流时的数值偏移

BATT8_AMP_PERVLT.Description: 电池8电流传感器上1V读数所对应的安培数。 对于使用3DR Power版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。对于使用3DR 4in1 ESC版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。

BATT8_ARM_MAH.DisplayName: 解锁所需电池8剩余电量
BATT8_ARM_MAH.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池8的剩余电量。设置为0可在任何剩余容量下解锁飞机。 请注意，除了智能电池重新启动之外，飞机始终会重置剩余电量估算值，这可能会导致此检查无法提供足够的保护，建议始终将此功能与以下功能结合使用：@

BATT8_ARM_VOLT.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池8的电压。设置为0允许在任何电压下解锁。

BATT8_BUS.DisplayName: 电池8监控器的I2C总线编号
BATT8_BUS.Description: 电池8监控器的I2C总线编号。

BATT8_CAPACITY.Description: 电池8的总容量（以mAh为单位）

BATT8_CRT_MAH.Description: 触发低电量保护的电池8的电池容量。设置为0可禁用低电量保护功能。 如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT8_CRT_VOLT.Description: 触发电池8的低电压故障保护的电压值。设置为0则禁用。 如果电池电压持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT8_CURR_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电池8电流监控的模拟输入引脚。

BATT8_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: 遇到电池8故障，飞机应采取的措施。

BATT8_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: 电池8电量不足时，飞机应采取什么措施。

BATT8_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: 用于检测电池8电压的算法
BATT8_FS_VOLTSRC.Values: 0:原始电压数据, 1:凹陷补偿电压

BATT8_LOW_MAH.Description: 触发电池8低电量的电池容量。 设置为0可禁用电池低电量保护功能。如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT8_LOW_TIMER.Description: 这是触发电池8低电压事件之前的延时时间（以秒为单位）。对于具有低C电池的飞机，可能有必要将延时调长，以应对加速或起飞时的瞬时压降。 ‘0’值将不启用此功能。

BATT8_LOW_VOLT.Description: 触发电池8的低电压故障保护的电压值。设置为0则禁用。 如果电池电压持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT8_MONITOR.Description: 通过控件可以监视电池的电压和电流
BATT8_MONITOR.Values: 0:不允许,3:仅ADC电压,4:ADC电压和电流,5:单口,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Maxell,8:UAVCAN-电池信息,9:BLHeli ESC回传（DShot）,10:SumOfFollowing,11:FuelFlow,12:燃油水平PWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign

BATT8_SERIAL_NUM.Description: 自动为SMBus电池填写的电池序列号，否则为-1。 对于UAVCAN，它是battery_id。

BATT8_VOLT_MULT.Description: 用于转换感应引脚的电压(@

BATT8_VOLT_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电压监视的模拟输入引脚。

BATT8_WATT_MAX.Description: 如果电池输出瓦数（电压*电流）超过此值，则系统将减小油门（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）以满足此限制。 这有助于在使用低倍率电池的飞机上安全的飞行，而不管电池电压如何。 当实际电流小于了最大电流值 且 实际功率低于了最大功率值，则各油门限制将缓慢增长回原始设置值（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）。 ‘0’禁用。

BATT9_AMP_OFFSET.Description: 电池9电流传感器零电流时的数值偏移

BATT9_AMP_PERVLT.Description: 电池9电流传感器上1V读数所对应的安培数。 对于使用3DR Power版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。对于使用3DR 4in1 ESC版的Pixhawk，应将其设置为17。

BATT9_ARM_MAH.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池9的剩余电量。设置为0可在任何剩余容量下解锁飞机。 请注意，除了智能电池重新启动之外，飞机始终会重置剩余电量估算值，这可能会导致此检查无法提供足够的保护，建议始终将此功能与以下功能结合使用：@

BATT9_ARM_VOLT.Description: 解锁飞机所需电池9的电压。设置为0允许在任何电压下解锁。

BATT9_BUS.DisplayName: 电池9监控器的I2C总线编号
BATT9_BUS.Description: 电池9监控器的I2C总线编号。

BATT9_CAPACITY.Description: 电池9的总容量（以mAh为单位）

BATT9_CRT_MAH.Description: 触发低电量保护的电池9的电池容量。设置为0可禁用低电量保护功能。 如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: 电池9电量不足时，飞机应采取什么措施。

BATT9_FS_VOLTSRC.Values: 0:原始电压数据, 1:凹陷补偿电压

BATT9_LOW_MAH.Description: 触发电池9低电量的电池容量。 设置为0可禁用电池低电量保护功能。如果电池容量低于此水平，则飞机将执行：@

BATT9_LOW_TIMER.Description: 这是触发电池9低电压事件之前的延时时间（以秒为单位）。对于具有低C电池的飞机，可能有必要将延时调长，以应对加速或起飞时的瞬时压降。 ‘0’值将不启用此功能。

BATT9_LOW_VOLT.Description: 触发电池9的低电压故障保护的电压值。设置为0则禁用。 如果电池电压持续低于此电压并持续时间超过延迟时间@

BATT9_MONITOR.Description: 通过控件可以监视电池的电压和电流
BATT9_MONITOR.Values: 0:不允许,3:仅ADC电压,4:ADC电压和电流,5:单口,6:Bebop,7:SMBus-Maxell,8:UAVCAN-电池信息,9:BLHeli ESC回传（DShot）,10:SumOfFollowing,11:FuelFlow,12:燃油水平PWM,13:SMBUS-SUI3,14:SMBUS-SUI6,15:NeoDesign

BATT9_SERIAL_NUM.Description: 自动为SMBus电池填写的电池序列号，否则为-1。 对于UAVCAN，它是battery_id。

BATT9_VOLT_MULT.Description: 用于转换感应引脚的电压(@

BATT9_VOLT_PIN.Description: 设置应用于电压监视的模拟输入引脚。

BATT9_WATT_MAX.Description: 如果电池输出瓦数（电压*电流）超过此值，则系统将减小油门（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）以满足此限制。 这有助于在使用低倍率电池的飞机上安全的飞行，而不管电池电压如何。 当实际电流小于了最大电流值 且 实际功率低于了最大功率值，则各油门限制将缓慢增长回原始设置值（THR_MAX，TKOFF_THR_MAX，THR_MIN）。 ‘0’禁用。

BRD_ALT_CONFIG.Description: Select an alternative hardware configuration. A value of zero selects the default configuration for this board. Other values are board specific. Please see the documentation for your board for details on any alternative configuration values that may be available.

BRD_BOOT_DELAY.Description: This adds a delay in milliseconds to boot to ensure peripherals initialise fully

BRD_IMU_TARGTEMP.Description: This sets the target IMU temperature for boards with controllable IMU heating units. DO NOT SET -1 on The Cube. A value of -1 sets PH1 behaviour

BRD_IO_ENABLE.Description: This allows for the IO co-processor on FMUv1 and FMUv2 to be disabled

BRD_PWM_COUNT.Description: Controls number of FMU outputs which are setup for PWM. All unassigned pins can be used for GPIO
BRD_PWM_COUNT.Values: 0:No PWMs,1:One PWMs,2:Two PWMs,3:Three PWMs,4:Four PWMs,5:Five PWMs,6:Six PWMs,7:Seven PWMs,8:Eight PWMs

BRD_PWM_VOLT_SEL.Description: This sets the voltage max for PWM output pulses. 0 for 3.3V and 1 for 5V output.

BRD_RADIO_ABLVL.Description: This sets the minimum RSSI of an auto-bind packet for it to be accepted. This should be set so that auto-bind will only happen at short range to minimise the change of an auto-bind happening accidentially

BRD_RADIO_ABTIME.Description: When non-zero this sets the time with no transmitter packets before we start looking for auto-bind packets.

BRD_RADIO_BZOFS.Description: Set transmitter buzzer note adjustment (adjust frequency up)

BRD_RADIO_FCCTST.DisplayName: Put radio into FCC test mode
BRD_RADIO_FCCTST.Description: If this is enabled then the radio will continuously transmit as required for FCC testing. The transmit channel is set by the value of the parameter. The radio will not work for RC input while this is enabled

BRD_RADIO_PPSCH.Description: Channel to show received packet-per-second rate, or zero for disabled

BRD_RADIO_SIGCH.Description: Channel to show receive RSSI signal strength, or zero for disabled

BRD_RADIO_STKMD.Description: This selects between different stick input modes. The default is mode2, which has throttle on the left stick and pitch on the right stick. You can instead set mode1, which has throttle on the right stick and pitch on the left stick.

BRD_RADIO_TELEM.Description: If this is non-zero then telemetry packets will be sent over DSM

BRD_RADIO_TESTCH.DisplayName: Set radio to factory test channel
BRD_RADIO_TESTCH.Description: This sets the radio to a fixed test channel for factory testing. Using a fixed channel avoids the need for binding in factory testing.

BRD_RADIO_TPPSCH.Description: Channel to show telemetry packets-per-second value, as received at TX

BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH.DisplayName: RSSI value channel for telemetry data on transmitter
BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH.Description: Channel to show telemetry RSSI value as received by TX

BRD_RADIO_TXMAX.Description: Set transmitter maximum transmit power (from 1 to 8)

BRD_RADIO_TXPOW.Description: Set telemetry transmit power. This is the power level (from 1 to 8) for telemetry packets sent from the RX to the TX

BRD_RADIO_TYPE.DisplayName: Set type of direct attached radio
BRD_RADIO_TYPE.Description: This enables support for direct attached radio receivers

BRD_RTC_TYPES.Description: Specifies which sources of UTC time will be accepted

BRD_RTC_TZ_MIN.Description: Adds offset in +- minutes from UTC to calculate local time

BRD_SAFETY_MASK.DisplayName: Outputs which ignore the safety switch state
BRD_SAFETY_MASK.Description: A bitmask which controls what outputs can move while the safety switch has not been pressed

BRD_SAFETYENABLE.DisplayName: Enable use of safety arming switch
BRD_SAFETYENABLE.Description: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.

BRD_SAFETYOPTION.Description: This controls the activation of the safety button. It allows you to control if the safety button can be used for safety enable and/or disable, and whether the button is only active when disarmed
BRD_SAFETYOPTION.Bitmask: 0:ActiveForSafetyEnable,1:ActiveForSafetyDisable,2:ActiveWhenArmed,3:Force safety on when the aircraft disarms

BRD_SBUS_OUT.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

BRD_SD_SLOWDOWN.Description: This is a scaling factor to slow down microSD operation. It can be used on flight board and microSD card combinations where full speed is not reliable. For normal full speed operation a value of 0 should be used.

BRD_SER1_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1) on Pixhawk. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

BRD_SER2_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2) on Pixhawk and STATE. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SERIAL_NUM.Description: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

BRD_TYPE.Description: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)
BRD_TYPE.Values: 0:AUTO,1:PX4V1,2:Pixhawk,3:Cube/Pixhawk2,4:Pixracer,5:PixhawkMini,6:Pixhawk2Slim,7:VRBrain 5.1,8:VRBrain 5.2,9:VR Micro Brain 5.1,10:VR Micro Brain 5.2,11:VRBrain Core 1.0,12:VRBrain 5.4,13:Intel Aero FC,20:AUAV2.1

BRD_VBUS_MIN.Description: Minimum voltage on the autopilot power rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

BRD_VSERVO_MIN.Description: Minimum voltage on the servo rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

CAN_D1_KDE_NPOLE.Description: 设置电动机极数以计算正确的转速(RPM)值

CAN_D1_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: 通过虚拟驱动程序启用特定协议的使用
CAN_D1_PROTOCOL.Description: 启用此选项将启动将使用此虚拟驱动程序的选定协议

CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将通过UAVCAN作为ESC传输
CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM.Description: 具有一组通道的位掩码，可通过UAVCAN作为ESC命令发送通道

CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将作为伺服通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM.Description: 具有一组用于通道的位掩码，以作为通道命令通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM.Bitmask: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

CAN_D1_UC_SRV_RT.Description: 伺服输出的最大传输速率，单位Hz

CAN_D2_KDE_NPOLE.Description: 设置电动机极数以计算正确的转速(RPM)值

CAN_D2_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: 通过虚拟驱动程序启用特定协议的使用
CAN_D2_PROTOCOL.Description: 启用此选项将启动将使用此虚拟驱动程序的选定协议

CAN_D2_UC_ESC_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将通过UAVCAN作为ESC传输
CAN_D2_UC_ESC_BM.Description: 具有一组通道的位掩码，可通过UAVCAN作为ESC命令发送通道

CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将作为伺服通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM.Description: 具有一组用于通道的位掩码，以作为通道命令通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM.Bitmask: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

CAN_D2_UC_SRV_RT.Description: 伺服输出的最大传输速率，单位Hz

CAN_D3_KDE_NPOLE.Description: 设置电动机极数以计算正确的转速(RPM)值

CAN_D3_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: 通过虚拟驱动程序启用特定协议的使用
CAN_D3_PROTOCOL.Description: 启用此选项将启动将使用此虚拟驱动程序的选定协议

CAN_D3_UC_ESC_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将通过UAVCAN作为ESC传输
CAN_D3_UC_ESC_BM.Description: 具有一组通道的位掩码，可通过UAVCAN作为ESC命令发送通道

CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM.DisplayName: RC Out通道将作为伺服通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM.Description: 具有一组用于通道的位掩码，以作为通道命令通过UAVCAN传输
CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM.Bitmask: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

CAN_D3_UC_SRV_RT.Description: 伺服输出的最大传输速率，单位Hz

CAN_P1_DEBUG.Description: 启用此选项将提供调试消息

CAN_P1_DRIVER.Description: 启用此选项将启用CAN总线。

CAN_P2_DEBUG.Description: 启用此选项将提供调试消息

CAN_P2_DRIVER.Description: 启用此选项将启用CAN总线。

CAN_P3_DEBUG.Description: 启用此选项将提供调试消息

CAN_P3_DRIVER.Description: 启用此选项将启用CAN总线。

CAN_SLCAN_CPORT.Description: CAN Driver ID to be routed to SLCAN, 0 means no routing

CAN_SLCAN_SERNUM.Description: Serial Port ID to be used for temporary SLCAN iface, -1 means no temporary serial. This parameter is automatically reset on reboot or on timeout. See CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT for timeout details

CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT.Description: Duration of inactivity after which SLCAN is switched back to original protocol in seconds.

CMD_TOTAL.Description: Set to 1 if HOME location has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

COMPASS_AUTO_ROT.Description: When enabled this will automatically check the orientation of compasses on successful completion of compass calibration. If set to 2 then external compasses will have their orientation automatically corrected.

COMPASS_AUTODEC.Description: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

COMPASS_CAL_FIT.Description: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

COMPASS_CUS_PIT.Description: Compass mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_CUS_ROLL.Description: Compass mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_CUS_YAW.Description: Compass mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

COMPASS_DEC.Description: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

COMPASS_DEV_ID.Description: Compass device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID2.Description: Second compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID3.Description: Third compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID4.Description: Extra 4th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID5.Description: Extra 5th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID6.Description: Extra 6th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID7.Description: Extra 7th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID8.Description: Extra 8th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DIA_X.DisplayName: 指南针软铁对角线X分量
COMPASS_DIA_X.Description: 指南针软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_X：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Y.Description: 指南针软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Y：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Z.DisplayName: 指南针软铁对角线Z分量
COMPASS_DIA_Z.Description: 指南针软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Z：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_X.Description: 指南针2软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_X：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Y.Description: 指南针2软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Y：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Z.DisplayName: 指南针2软铁对角线Z分量
COMPASS_DIA2_Z.Description: 指南针2软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Z：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_X.Description: 指南针3软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_X：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Y.Description: 指南针3软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Y：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Z.DisplayName: 指南针3软铁对角线Z分量
COMPASS_DIA3_Z.Description: 指南针3软铁校准矩阵中的DIA_Z：[[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

COMPASS_EXTERN2.DisplayName: Compass2 is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERN2.Description: Configure second compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_EXTERN3.DisplayName: Compass3 is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERN3.Description: Configure third compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_EXTERNAL.DisplayName: Compass is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERNAL.Description: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_FLTR_RNG.DisplayName: Range in which sample is accepted
COMPASS_FLTR_RNG.Description: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

COMPASS_LEARN.Description: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle. If InFlight learning is enabled then the compass with automatically start learning once a flight starts (must be armed). While InFlight learning is running you cannot use position control modes.

COMPASS_MOT_X.DisplayName: 机身框架X轴的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT_X.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT_Y.DisplayName: 机身框架Y轴的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT_Y.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的Y轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT_Z.DisplayName: 机身框架Z轴的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT_Z.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的Z轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT2_X.DisplayName: 机身框架X轴对罗盘2的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT2_X.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT2_Y.DisplayName: 机身框架Y轴对罗盘2的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT2_Y.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT2_Z.DisplayName: 机身框架Z轴对罗盘2的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT2_Z.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT3_X.DisplayName: 机身框架X轴对罗盘3的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT3_X.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT3_Y.DisplayName: 机身框架Y轴对罗盘3的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT3_Y.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOT3_Z.DisplayName: 机身框架Z轴对罗盘3的电机电流干扰补偿
COMPASS_MOT3_Z.Description: 乘以当前电流值并加到指南针的X轴值以补偿电动机电流干扰（每安培偏移或全油门偏移）

COMPASS_MOTCT.Description: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

COMPASS_ODI_X.DisplayName: 指南针软铁非对角X分量
COMPASS_ODI_X.Description: 罗盘软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_X: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI_Y.DisplayName: 指南针软铁非对角Y分量
COMPASS_ODI_Y.Description: 罗盘软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Y: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI_Z.DisplayName: 指南针软铁非对角Z分量
COMPASS_ODI_Z.Description: 罗盘软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Z: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_X.DisplayName: 指南针2软铁非对角X分量
COMPASS_ODI2_X.Description: 罗盘2软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_X: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_Y.DisplayName: 指南针2软铁非对角Y分量
COMPASS_ODI2_Y.Description: 罗盘2软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Y: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_Z.DisplayName: 指南针2软铁非对角Z分量
COMPASS_ODI2_Z.Description: 罗盘2软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Z: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_X.DisplayName: 指南针3软铁非对角X分量
COMPASS_ODI3_X.Description: 罗盘3软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_X: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_Y.DisplayName: 指南针3软铁非对角Y分量
COMPASS_ODI3_Y.Description: 罗盘3软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Y: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_Z.DisplayName: 指南针3软铁非对角Z分量
COMPASS_ODI3_Z.Description: 罗盘3软铁校准矩阵中的ODI_Z: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_OFFS_MAX.Description: 这将设置校准和解锁检查中允许的最大指南针偏移

COMPASS_OFS_X.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘X轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS_Y.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘Y轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS_Z.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘Z轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS2_X.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘2的X轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS2_Y.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘2的Y轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS2_Z.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘2的Z轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS3_X.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘3的X轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS3_Y.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘3的Y轴偏移值

COMPASS_OFS3_Z.Description: 因机身框架中的永磁体导致的罗盘3的Z轴偏移值

COMPASS_OPTIONS.Description: 设置选项以更改指南针的数据源

COMPASS_ORIENT.Description: 外部罗盘1相对于机身框架的方向。 除非将此罗盘设置为外部罗盘，否则将忽略此值。 在指向北半球时，正确的设置应有将前方和右侧指向下方则分别增加MagX和MagY的值。 俯视逆时针旋转机身框架则会降低MagZ的值。 对于指向南半球，则数据相反。 注意：对于内部指南针，使用AHRS_ORIENT。

COMPASS_ORIENT2.Description: 外部罗盘2相对于机身框架的方向。 除非将此罗盘设置为外部罗盘，否则将忽略此值。 在指向北半球时，正确的设置应有将前方和右侧指向下方则分别增加MagX和MagY的值。 俯视逆时针旋转机身框架则会降低MagZ的值。 对于指向南半球，则数据相反。 注意：对于内部指南针，使用AHRS_ORIENT。

COMPASS_ORIENT3.Description: 外部罗盘3相对于机身框架的方向。 除非将此罗盘设置为外部罗盘，否则将忽略此值。 在指向北半球时，正确的设置应有将前方和右侧指向下方则分别增加MagX和MagY的值。 俯视逆时针旋转机身框架则会降低MagZ的值。 对于指向南半球，则数据相反。 注意：对于内部指南针，使用AHRS_ORIENT。

COMPASS_PMOT_EN.DisplayName: 电机独立罗盘校正启用
COMPASS_PMOT_EN.Description: 这可以实现每个电机单独对罗盘的校正

COMPASS_PMOT_EXP.Description: 用电机的输出功率值的指数对罗盘进行校正，这里调整的是指数系数。

COMPASS_PRIO1_ID.DisplayName: 指南针设备ID具有一级优先级
COMPASS_PRIO1_ID.Description: 指南针设备ID具有一级优先级，如果设置为0，则会自动设置。更改后需要重新引导。

COMPASS_PRIO2_ID.DisplayName: 指南针设备ID具有第二优先级
COMPASS_PRIO2_ID.Description: 指南针设备ID具有第二优先级，如果设置为0，则会自动设置。更改后需要重新启动。

COMPASS_PRIO3_ID.DisplayName: 指南针设备ID具有第三优先级
COMPASS_PRIO3_ID.Description: 指南针设备ID具有第三优先级，如果设置为0，则会自动设置。更改后需要重新启动。

COMPASS_SCALE.Description: 第一个罗盘的比例因子，以补偿传感器的比例误差。 如果为0，则不进行缩放

COMPASS_SCALE2.Description: 第二个罗盘的比例因子，以补偿传感器的比例误差。 如果为0，则不进行缩放

COMPASS_SCALE3.Description: 第三个罗盘的比例因子，以补偿传感器的比例误差。 如果为0，则不进行缩放

COMPASS_TYPEMASK.DisplayName: 指南针禁用驱动程序类型掩码
COMPASS_TYPEMASK.Description: 这是要禁用的驱动程序类型的位掩码。 如果在此掩码中设置了驱动程序类型，则该驱动程序将不会在启动时尝试查找传感器。

COMPASS_USE.DisplayName: 使用指南针1来确定航向
COMPASS_USE.Description: 启用或禁用使用指南针1（而不是GPS）来确定航向

COMPASS_USE2.DisplayName: 使用指南针2来确定航向
COMPASS_USE2.Description: 启用或禁用使用指南针2（而不是GPS）来确定航向

COMPASS_USE3.DisplayName: 使用指南针3来确定航向
COMPASS_USE3.Description: 启用或禁用使用指南针3（而不是GPS）来确定航向

DISTANCE_MIN.Description: Tracker will track targets at least this distance away

FORMAT_VERSION.Description: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

GCS_PID_MASK.Description: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

GND_ALT_OFFSET.Description: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

GND_EXT_BUS.Description: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer. When set to -1 it will probe all external i2c buses based on the GND_PROBE_EXT parameter.

GND_FLTR_RNG.DisplayName: Range in which sample is accepted
GND_FLTR_RNG.Description: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

GND_PRIMARY.Description: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

GND_PROBE_EXT.Description: This sets which types of external i2c barometer to look for. It is a bitmask of barometer types. The I2C buses to probe is based on GND_EXT_BUS. If GND_EXT_BUS is -1 then it will probe all external buses, otherwise it will probe just the bus number given in GND_EXT_BUS.

GND_SPEC_GRAV.Description: This sets the specific gravity of the fluid when flying an underwater ROV.

GND_TEMP.Description: User provided ambient ground temperature in degrees Celsius. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means use the internal measurement ambient temperature.

GPS_AUTO_CONFIG.Description: Controls if the autopilot should automatically configure the GPS based on the parameters and default settings

GPS_AUTO_SWITCH.Description: Automatic switchover to GPS reporting best lock

GPS_BLEND_MASK.Description: Determines which of the accuracy measures Horizontal position, Vertical Position and Speed are used to calculate the weighting on each GPS receiver when soft switching has been selected by setting GPS_AUTO_SWITCH to 2

GPS_BLEND_TC.Description: Controls the slowest time constant applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to adjust different GPS receivers for steady state position differences.

GPS_DELAY_MS.Description: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.

GPS_DELAY_MS2.Description: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.

GPS_DRV_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:Use UART2 for moving baseline on ublox

GPS_GNSS_MODE.Description: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the first GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

GPS_GNSS_MODE2.Description: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the second GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

GPS_INJECT_TO.Description: The GGS can send raw serial packets to inject data to multiple GPSes.
GPS_INJECT_TO.Values: 0:send to first GPS,1:send to 2nd GPS,127:send to all

GPS_MIN_DGPS.DisplayName: Minimum Lock Type Accepted for DGPS
GPS_MIN_DGPS.Description: Sets the minimum type of differential GPS corrections required before allowing to switch into DGPS mode.

GPS_MIN_ELEV.Description: This sets the minimum elevation of satellites above the horizon for them to be used for navigation. Setting this to -100 leaves the minimum elevation set to the GPS modules default.

GPS_POS1_X.Description: X position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS1_Y.Description: Y position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS1_Z.Description: Z position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS2_X.Description: X position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS2_Y.Description: Y position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS2_Z.Description: Z position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_RATE_MS.Description: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz is not allowed

GPS_RATE_MS2.Description: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz is not allowed

GPS_RAW_DATA.Description: Handles logging raw data; on uBlox chips that support raw data this will log RXM messages into logger; on Septentrio this will log on the equipment's SD card and when set to 2, the autopilot will try to stop logging after disarming and restart after arming
GPS_RAW_DATA.Values: 0:Ignore,1:Always log,2:Stop logging when disarmed (SBF only),5:Only log every five samples (uBlox only)

GPS_SAVE_CFG.Description: Determines whether the configuration for this GPS should be written to non-volatile memory on the GPS. Currently working for UBlox 6 series and above.
GPS_SAVE_CFG.Values: 0:Do not save config,1:Save config,2:Save only when needed

GPS_SBAS_MODE.Description: This sets the SBAS (satellite based augmentation system) mode if available on this GPS. If set to 2 then the SBAS mode is not changed in the GPS. Otherwise the GPS will be reconfigured to enable/disable SBAS. Disabling SBAS may be worthwhile in some parts of the world where an SBAS signal is available but the baseline is too long to be useful.

GPS_SBP_LOGMASK.Description: Masked with the SBP msg_type field to determine whether SBR1/SBR2 data is logged

INITIAL_MODE.DisplayName: Mode tracker will switch into after initialization

INS_ACC_BODYFIX.Description: The body-fixed accelerometer to be used for trim calculation

INS_ACC_ID.Description: Accelerometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ACC2_ID.Description: Accelerometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ACC2OFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2OFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2OFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2SCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC2SCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC2SCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3_ID.Description: Accelerometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ACC3OFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3OFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3OFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3SCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3SCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3SCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCEL_FILTER.Description: Filter cutoff frequency for accelerometers. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

INS_ACCOFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCSCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ENABLE_MASK.Description: Bitmask of IMUs to enable. It can be used to prevent startup of specific detected IMUs

INS_FAST_SAMPLE.Description: Mask of IMUs to enable fast sampling on, if available

INS_GYR_CAL.Description: Conrols when automatic gyro calibration is performed

INS_GYR_ID.Description: Gyro sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_GYR2_ID.Description: Gyro2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_GYR2OFFS_X.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR2OFFS_Y.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR2OFFS_Z.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3_ID.Description: Gyro3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_GYR3OFFS_X.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3OFFS_Y.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3OFFS_Z.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYRO_FILTER.Description: Filter cutoff frequency for gyroscopes. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

INS_GYROFFS_X.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Y.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Z.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_HNTCH_ATT.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB

INS_HNTCH_BW.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz

INS_HNTCH_FREQ.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. For helicopters using RPM sensor to dynamically set the notch frequency, use this parameter to provide a lower limit to the dynamic notch filter. Recommend setting it to half the operating rotor speed in Hz.

INS_HNTCH_HMNCS.Description: Bitmask of harmonic frequencies to apply Harmonic Notch Filter to. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A maximum of 3 harmonics can be used at any one time.
INS_HNTCH_HMNCS.Bitmask: 0:1st harmonic,1:2nd harmonic,2:3rd harmonic,3:4th hamronic,4:5th harmonic,5:6th harmonic,6:7th harmonic,7:8th harmonic

INS_HNTCH_MODE.DisplayName: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode
INS_HNTCH_MODE.Description: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode. Dynamic updates can be throttle, RPM sensor, ESC telemetry or dynamic FFT based. Throttle-based updates should only be used with multicopters.

INS_HNTCH_REF.Description: A reference value of zero disables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter and a positive value enables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter. For throttle-based scaling, this parameter is the reference value associated with the specified frequency to facilitate frequency scaling of the Harmonic Notch Filter. For RPM and ESC telemetry based tracking, this parameter is set to 1 to enable the Harmonic Notch Filter using the RPM sensor or ESC telemetry set to measure rotor speed. The sensor data is converted to Hz automatically for use in the Harmonic Notch Filter. This reference value may also be used to scale the sensor data, if required. For example, rpm sensor data is required to measure heli motor RPM. Therefore the reference value can be used to scale the RPM sensor to the rotor RPM.

INS_LOG_BAT_CNT.Description: Number of samples to take when logging streams of IMU sensor readings. Will be rounded down to a multiple of 32. This option takes effect on the next reboot.

INS_LOG_BAT_LGCT.Description: Number of samples to push to count every @

INS_LOG_BAT_LGIN.Description: Interval between pushing samples to the AP_Logger log

INS_LOG_BAT_MASK.Description: Bitmap of which IMUs to log batch data for. This option takes effect on the next reboot.

INS_LOG_BAT_OPT.Description: Options for the BatchSampler. Post-filter and sensor-rate logging cannot be used at the same time.
INS_LOG_BAT_OPT.Bitmask: 0:Sensor-Rate Logging (sample at full sensor rate seen by AP), 1: Sample post-filtering

INS_POS1_X.Description: X position of the first IMU Accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS1_Y.Description: Y position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS1_Z.Description: Z position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS2_X.Description: X position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS2_Y.Description: Y position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS2_Z.Description: Z position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS3_X.Description: X position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS3_Y.Description: Y position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS3_Z.Description: Z position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_STILL_THRESH.DisplayName: Stillness threshold for detecting if we are moving
INS_STILL_THRESH.Description: Threshold to tolerate vibration to determine if vehicle is motionless. This depends on the frame type and if there is a constant vibration due to motors before launch or after landing. Total motionless is about 0.05. Suggested values: Planes/rover use 0.1, multirotors use 1, tradHeli uses 5

INS_TRIM_OPTION.Description: Specifies how the accel cal routine determines the trims
INS_TRIM_OPTION.Values: 0:Don't adjust the trims,1:Assume first orientation was level,2:Assume ACC_BODYFIX is perfectly aligned to the vehicle

INS_USE.DisplayName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE.Description: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS_USE2.DisplayName: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE2.Description: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS_USE3.DisplayName: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE3.Description: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

LOG_BACKEND_TYPE.Description: Bitmap of what Logger backend types to enable. Block-based logging is available on SITL and boards with dataflash chips. Multiple backends can be selected.

LOG_BITMASK.Description: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

LOG_DISARMED.Description: If LOG_DISARMED is set to 1 then logging will be enabled while disarmed. This can make for very large logfiles but can help a lot when tracking down startup issues

LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.DisplayName: Maximum AP_Logger File Backend buffer size (in kilobytes)
LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.Description: The AP_Logger_File backend uses a buffer to store data before writing to the block device. Raising this value may reduce "gaps" in your SD card logging. This buffer size may be reduced depending on available memory. PixHawk requires at least 4 kilobytes. Maximum value available here is 64 kilobytes.

LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.DisplayName: Stop logging to current file on disarm
LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.Description: When set, the current log file is closed when the vehicle is disarmed. If LOG_DISARMED is set then a fresh log will be opened.

LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT.DisplayName: Timeout before giving up on file writes
LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT.Description: This controls the amount of time before failing writes to a log file cause the file to be closed and logging stopped.

LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE.DisplayName: Maximum AP_Logger MAVLink Backend buffer size
LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE.Description: Maximum amount of memory to allocate to AP_Logger-over-mavlink

LOG_REPLAY.DisplayName: Enable logging of information needed for Replay
LOG_REPLAY.Description: If LOG_REPLAY is set to 1 then the EKF2 state estimator will log detailed information needed for diagnosing problems with the Kalman filter. It is suggested that you also raise LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE to give more buffer space for logging and use a high quality microSD card to ensure no sensor data is lost

MAV_UPDATE_RATE.Description: The rate at which Mavlink updates position and baro data

MIN_REVERSE_TIME.DisplayName: Minimum time to apply a yaw reversal
MIN_REVERSE_TIME.Description: When the tracker detects it has reached the limit of servo movement in yaw it will reverse and try moving to the other extreme of yaw. This parameter controls the minimum time it should reverse for. It is used to cope with trackers that have a significant lag in movement to ensure they do move all the way around.

NTF_BUZZ_ON_LVL.Description: Specifies pin level that indicates buzzer should play

NTF_BUZZ_PIN.Description: Enables to connect active buzzer to arbitrary pin. Requires 3-pin buzzer or additional MOSFET!

NTF_DISPLAY_TYPE.Description: This sets up the type of on-board I2C display. Disabled by default.

NTF_LED_BRIGHT.Description: Select the RGB LED brightness level. When USB is connected brightness will never be higher than low regardless of the setting.

NTF_LED_LEN.Description: The number of Serial LED's to use for notifications (NeoPixel's and ProfiLED)

NTF_LED_OVERRIDE.DisplayName: Specifies colour source for the RGBLed
NTF_LED_OVERRIDE.Description: Specifies the source for the colours and brightness for the LED. OutbackChallenge conforms to the MedicalExpress (https://uavchallenge.org/medical-express/) rules, essentially "Green" is disarmed (safe-to-approach), "Red" is armed (not safe-to-approach). Traffic light is a simplified color set, red when armed, yellow when the safety switch is not surpressing outputs (but disarmed), and green when outputs are surpressed and disarmed, the LED will blink faster if disarmed and failing arming checks.

NTF_LED_TYPES.Description: Controls what types of LEDs will be enabled
NTF_LED_TYPES.Bitmask: 0:Build in LED, 1:Internal ToshibaLED, 2:External ToshibaLED, 3:External PCA9685, 4:Oreo LED, 5:UAVCAN, 6:NCP5623 External, 7:NCP5623 Internal, 8:NeoPixel, 9:ProfiLED

NTF_OREO_THEME.Description: Enable/Disable Solo Oreo LED driver, 0 to disable, 1 for Aircraft theme, 2 for Rover theme

ONOFF_PITCH_MINT.Description: Minimim amount of time in seconds to move in pitch

ONOFF_PITCH_RATE.Description: Rate of change of pitch in degrees/second for on/off servos

ONOFF_YAW_MINT.Description: Minimum amount of time in seconds to move in yaw

ONOFF_YAW_RATE.Description: Rate of change of yaw in degrees/second for on/off servos

PITCH_MAX.Description: The highest angle the pitch can reach

PITCH_MIN.Description: The lowest angle the pitch can reach

PITCH_SLEW_TIME.DisplayName: Time for pitch to slew through its full range
PITCH_SLEW_TIME.Description: This controls how rapidly the tracker will change the servo output for pitch. It is set as the number of seconds to do a full range of pitch movement. You can use this parameter to slow the trackers movements, which may help with some types of trackers. A value of zero will allow for unlimited servo movement per update.

PITCH_TRIM.Description: Amount of extra pitch to add when tracking. This allows for small adjustments for a badly calibrated barometer.

PITCH2SRV_D.Description: Pitch axis controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch angle vs actual pitch angle

PITCH2SRV_FLTD.DisplayName: Pitch axis controller derivative frequency in Hz
PITCH2SRV_FLTD.Description: Pitch axis controller derivative frequency in Hz

PITCH2SRV_FLTE.DisplayName: Pitch axis controller error frequency in Hz
PITCH2SRV_FLTE.Description: Pitch axis controller error frequency in Hz

PITCH2SRV_FLTT.DisplayName: Pitch axis controller target frequency in Hz
PITCH2SRV_FLTT.Description: Pitch axis controller target frequency in Hz

PITCH2SRV_I.Description: Pitch axis controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch angle vs actual pitch angle

PITCH2SRV_IMAX.DisplayName: Pitch axis controller I gain maximum
PITCH2SRV_IMAX.Description: Pitch axis controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm change that the I gain will output

PITCH2SRV_P.Description: Pitch axis controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch angle and actual pitch angle into a pitch servo pwm change

RC_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:Ignore RC Receiver, 1:Ignore MAVLink Overrides, 2:Ignore Receiver Failsafe, 3:FPort Pad, 4:Log RC input bytes, 5:Arming check throttle for 0 input, 6:Skip the arming check for neutral Roll/Pitch/Yay sticks

RC_OVERRIDE_TIME.Description: Timeout after which RC overrides will no longer be used, and RC input will resume, 0 will disable RC overrides, -1 will never timeout, and continue using overrides until they are disabled

RC1_DZ.Description: PWM dead zone in microseconds around trim or bottom

RC1_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_OPTION.Description: Function assigned to this RC channel
RC1_OPTION.Values: 0:Do Nothing, 2:Flip, 3:Simple Mode, 4:RTL, 5:Save Trim, 7:Save WP, 9:Camera Trigger, 10:RangeFinder, 11:Fence, 13:Super Simple Mode, 14:Acro Trainer, 15:Sprayer, 16:Auto, 17:AutoTune, 18:Land, 19:Gripper, 21:Parachute Enable, 22:Parachute Release, 23:Parachute 3pos, 24:Auto Mission Reset, 25:AttCon Feed Forward, 26:AttCon Accel Limits, 27:Retract Mount, 28:Relay On/Off, 29:Landing Gear, 30:Lost Copter Sound, 31:Motor Emergency Stop, 32:Motor Interlock, 33:Brake, 34:Relay2 On/Off, 35:Relay3 On/Off, 36:Relay4 On/Off, 37:Throw, 38:ADSB Avoidance En, 39:PrecLoiter, 40:Proximity Avoidance, 41:ArmDisarm, 42:SmartRTL, 43:InvertedFlight, 46:RC Override Enable, 47:User Function 1, 48:User Function 2, 49:User Function 3, 52:Acro, 55:Guided, 56:Loiter, 57:Follow, 58:Clear Waypoints, 60:ZigZag, 61:ZigZag SaveWP, 62:Compass Learn, 65:GPS Disable, 66:Relay5, 67:Relay6, 68:Stabilize, 69:PosHold, 70:AltHold, 71:FlowHold, 72:Circle, 73:Drift, 76:Standby Mode, 78:RunCam Control, 79:RunCam OSD Control, 80:Viso Align, 81: Disarm, 100:KillIMU1, 101:KillIMU2, 102:Camera Mode Toggle

RC1_REVERSED.Description: Reverse channel input. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this input channel.

RC1_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC10_DZ.Description: PWM dead zone in microseconds around trim or bottom

RC10_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC10_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SAFE_DISARM_PWM.DisplayName: PWM that will be output when disarmed or in stop mode

SCAN_SPEED_PIT.DisplayName: Speed at which to rotate pitch axis in scan mode
SCAN_SPEED_PIT.Description: This controls how rapidly the tracker will move the servos in SCAN mode

SCAN_SPEED_YAW.DisplayName: Speed at which to rotate the yaw axis in scan mode
SCAN_SPEED_YAW.Description: This controls how rapidly the tracker will move the servos in SCAN mode

SCHED_DEBUG.Description: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

SCHED_LOOP_RATE.Description: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

SCR_DEBUG_LVL.Description: The higher the number the more verbose builtin scripting debug will be.

SCR_HEAP_SIZE.Description: Amount of memory available for scripting

SCR_VM_I_COUNT.Description: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

SERIAL_PASS1.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASS2.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASSTIMO.Description: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL0_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the console.

SERIAL1_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.
SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA

SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.
SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None, 1:MAVLink1, 2:MAVLink2, 3:Frsky D, 4:Frsky SPort, 5:GPS, 7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial, 8:SToRM32 Gimbal Serial, 9:Rangefinder, 10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX), 11:Lidar360, 13:Beacon, 14:Volz servo out, 15:SBus servo out, 16:ESC Telemetry, 17:Devo Telemetry, 18:OpticalFlow, 19:RobotisServo, 20:NMEA Output, 21:WindVane, 22:SLCAN, 23:RCIN, 24:MegaSquirt EFI, 25:LTM, 26:RunCam, 27:HottTelem, 28:Scripting

SERIAL2_BAUD.Description: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL2_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
SERIAL2_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA

SERIAL2_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem2 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.
SERIAL2_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None, 1:MAVLink1, 2:MAVLink2, 3:Frsky D, 4:Frsky SPort, 5:GPS, 7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial, 8:SToRM32 Gimbal Serial, 9:Rangefinder, 10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX), 11:Lidar360, 13:Beacon, 14:Volz servo out, 15:SBus servo out, 16:ESC Telemetry, 17:Devo Telemetry, 18:OpticalFlow, 19:RobotisServo, 20:NMEA Output, 21:WindVane, 22:SLCAN, 23:RCIN, 24:MegaSquirt EFI, 25:LTM, 26:RunCam, 27:HottTelem, 28:Scripting

SERIAL3_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used for the Serial 3 (GPS). Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL3_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
SERIAL3_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA

SERIAL3_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol Serial 3 (GPS) should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.
SERIAL3_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None, 1:MAVLink1, 2:MAVLink2, 3:Frsky D, 4:Frsky SPort, 5:GPS, 7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial, 8:SToRM32 Gimbal Serial, 9:Rangefinder, 10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX), 11:Lidar360, 13:Beacon, 14:Volz servo out, 15:SBus servo out, 16:ESC Telemetry, 17:Devo Telemetry, 18:OpticalFlow, 19:RobotisServo, 20:NMEA Output, 21:WindVane, 22:SLCAN, 23:RCIN, 24:MegaSquirt EFI, 25:LTM, 26:RunCam, 27:HottTelem, 28:Scripting

SERIAL4_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used for Serial4. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL4_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
SERIAL4_OPTIONS.Bitmask: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA

SERIAL4_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol Serial4 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.
SERIAL4_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None, 1:MAVLink1, 2:MAVLink2, 3:Frsky D, 4:Frsky SPort, 5:GPS, 7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial, 8:SToRM32 Gimbal Serial, 9:Rangefinder, 10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX), 11:Lidar360, 13:Beacon, 14:Volz servo out, 15:SBus servo out, 16:ESC Telemetry, 17:Devo Telemetry, 18:OpticalFlow, 19:RobotisServo, 20:NMEA Output, 21:WindVane, 22:SLCAN, 23:RCIN, 24:MegaSquirt EFI, 25:LTM, 26:RunCam, 27:HottTelem, 28:Scripting

SERVO_AUTO_TRIM.Description: This enables automatic servo trim in flight. Servos will be trimed in stabilized flight modes when the aircraft is close to level. Changes to servo trim will be saved every 10 seconds and will persist between flights. The automatic trim won't go more than 20% away from a centered trim.

SERVO_BLH_AUTO.Description: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors

SERVO_BLH_DEBUG.Description: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

SERVO_BLH_MASK.Description: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

SERVO_BLH_OTYPE.Description: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

SERVO_BLH_POLES.Description: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

SERVO_BLH_PORT.Description: This sets the serial port to use for blheli pass-thru

SERVO_BLH_REMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are reversible. This is used for ESCs which have been configured in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

SERVO_BLH_TEST.Description: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

SERVO_BLH_TMOUT.Description: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

SERVO_BLH_TRATE.Description: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

SERVO_PITCH_TYPE.DisplayName: Type of servo system being used for pitch
SERVO_PITCH_TYPE.Description: This allows selection of position servos or on/off servos for pitch

SERVO_RATE.Description: This sets the default output rate in Hz for all outputs.

SERVO_ROB_POSMAX.Description: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_ROB_POSMIN.Description: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_SBUS_RATE.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

SERVO_VOLZ_MASK.Description: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

SERVO_YAW_TYPE.DisplayName: Type of servo system being used for yaw
SERVO_YAW_TYPE.Description: This allows selection of position servos or on/off servos for yaw

SERVO1_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Seeing this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO1_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO1_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO1_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO1_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SIM_GRPE_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPE_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper emp is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the gripper servo simulation

SIM_GRPS_GRAB.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to initiate grabbing the cargo

SIM_GRPS_PIN.Description: The pin number that the gripper servo is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_GRPS_RELEASE.Description: PWM value in microseconds sent to Gripper to release the cargo

SIM_PLD_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Preland simulation

SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.DisplayName: Precland device origin's height above sealevel
SIM_PLD_HEIGHT.Description: Precland device origin's height above sealevel

SIM_PLD_RATE.Description: Precland device rate. e.g led patter refresh rate, RF message rate, etc.

SIM_PLD_TYPE.Description: Precland device radiance type: it can be a cylinder, a cone, or a sphere.

SIM_PLD_YAW.DisplayName: Precland device systems rotation from north
SIM_PLD_YAW.Description: Precland device systems rotation from north

SIM_SPR_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the Sprayer simulation

SIM_SPR_PUMP.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer pump is connected to. (start at 1)

SIM_SPR_SPIN.Description: The pin number that the Sprayer spinner servo is connected to. (start at 1)

START_LATITUDE.Description: Combined with START_LONGITUDE this parameter allows for an initial position of the tracker to be set. This position will be used until the GPS gets lock. It can also be used to run a stationary tracker with no GPS attached.

START_LONGITUDE.Description: Combined with START_LATITUDE this parameter allows for an initial position of the tracker to be set. This position will be used until the GPS gets lock. It can also be used to run a stationary tracker with no GPS attached.

STARTUP_DELAY.DisplayName: Delay before first servo movement from trim
STARTUP_DELAY.Description: This parameter can be used to force the servos to their trim value for a time on startup. This can help with some servo types

STAT_BOOTCNT.Description: Number of times board has been booted

STAT_RESET.Description: Seconds since January 1st 2016 (Unix epoch+1451606400) since statistics reset (set to 0 to reset statistics)

SYSID_MYGCS.Description: The identifier of the ground station in the MAVLink protocol. Don't change this unless you also modify the ground station to match.

SYSID_TARGET.Description: The identifier of the vehicle being tracked. This should be zero (to auto detect) or be the same as the SYSID_THISMAV parameter of the vehicle being tracked.

SYSID_THISMAV.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
SYSID_THISMAV.Description: Allows setting an individual system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

YAW_RANGE.Description: Yaw axis total range of motion in degrees

YAW_SLEW_TIME.DisplayName: Time for yaw to slew through its full range
YAW_SLEW_TIME.Description: This controls how rapidly the tracker will change the servo output for yaw. It is set as the number of seconds to do a full rotation. You can use this parameter to slow the trackers movements, which may help with some types of trackers. A value of zero will allow for unlimited servo movement per update.

YAW_TRIM.Description: Amount of extra yaw to add when tracking. This allows for small adjustments for an out of trim compass.

YAW2SRV_D.Description: Yaw axis controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw angle (heading) vs actual yaw angle

YAW2SRV_FLTD.DisplayName: Yaw axis controller derivative frequency in Hz
YAW2SRV_FLTD.Description: Yaw axis controller derivative frequency in Hz

YAW2SRV_FLTE.DisplayName: Yaw axis controller error frequency in Hz
YAW2SRV_FLTE.Description: Yaw axis controller error frequency in Hz

YAW2SRV_FLTT.DisplayName: Yaw axis controller target frequency in Hz
YAW2SRV_FLTT.Description: Yaw axis controller target frequency in Hz

YAW2SRV_I.Description: Yaw axis controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw angle (heading) vs actual yaw angle

YAW2SRV_IMAX.DisplayName: Yaw axis controller I gain maximum
YAW2SRV_IMAX.Description: Yaw axis controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm change that the I gain will output

YAW2SRV_P.Description: Yaw axis controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw angle (heading) and actual yaw angle into a yaw servo pwm change
